Reviews.Title: “Helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jill F
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central and within easy walking distance to many sights of Barcelona. The rooms are excellent, with comfy beds and enough space. The staff will answer any queries and offer help with anything you may need, recommending cafes and tapas bars or booking a scooter from a scooter hire shop. Although situated in a central position the hotel is very quiet and there is no noise from traffic or groups of tourists going home from a night on the Ramblas. Placa de Catalunya is very close and from there you can pick up the tourist buses which will take you all over the city to all the major tourist sites. Within walking distance is the Passeig de Gracia where you can find many cafes and tapas bars if you want something close to the hotel in the evening. When the sun is shining go down to the beaches and sit in a cafe drinking a beer. Or have a really good fish lunch in one of the restaurants directly on the beach. Another must is the Parc Guell, which is a little bit outside the main tourist area but well worth a visit. The tourist buses from Place de Catalunya will take you there. Don't only go to look at Sagrada Familia but pay the 12 € and go inside. The money goes towards finishing off the building which is absolutely spectacular, worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well run hotel with excellent breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: agj750
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated conveniently for buses and Metro links. It is a well run hotel, with helpful, organised staff. The rooms are clean and comfortable, although if you are a light sleeper I would suggest you specify a room at the rear of the hotel when booking. The breakfast is extremely good value and very well presented.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: PATRICIA H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located, a few hundred yards from the Metro at the bottom of Passeig De Gracia. Casa Mila and Batilo are an easy walk, 5/10 min away as is Place de Catalunya and La Ramblas. The hotel and it's staff were very pleasant and I would definitely use the hotel again. We opted to stay room only as breakfast seemed expensive; there are loads of places to get breafast within 5/10 mins of the hotel and we spent less for both of us than it would have cost for one at the hotel. If you are trying to stick to a budget then worth considering eating breakfast elsewhere. Our room was clean and well furnished with everything you could need. Our room was at the front of the building which did incur some raod noise, not a problem for me sleeping but might be for others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent convenient and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: oneHappycamper
Reviews.Content: This was my 3d at this hotel. It feels like home. Very friendly reception, convenient location and very comfartable. Excellent breakfast to start the day. Close to all public transportation and attraction. the only change I woul suggest is to have friendlier service at breakfast. They are efficient but alays made me uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in potential”
Reviews.Author: Stefan D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three times. Rooms are spacious and staff is friendly. First two times we got a room at the front, third time we arrived around 8 in BCN. When mentioning this at the the front desk the lady turned red and said: "if I would have know that I would have blocked a better room" They gave us a room at the back of the hotel, small and a louzy view. Terrible. Rooms in the front are way better. Roomservice is ok, ok food for friendly prices. Especially the house wine is great for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for service, location and value!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth B
Reviews.Content: We loved being in this hotel as the staff was most responsive and interested in our experience. We would strongly recommend this hotel. The rooms are well appointed and maintained and comfortable. The hotel offers a small spa, great location and is small and intimate. We will be back here again!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel enables thieves”
Reviews.Author: Nancy M
Reviews.Content: I and my family stayed at this hotel for 4 days. On our last day I checked three bags and received a bag check. When we returned to the hotel a short two hours later, the same bellman brought us two bags and noted that the bell check that he filled out only stated two. The location for the stored bags turned out to be a hallway without video surveillance. When I asked them to call the police they declined. My laptop and electronics were stolen and either they perpetuated the theft or at the very least enabled the situation through utter incompetent handling. After returning to the United States they stated they would file a police report on my behalf and have not done so. Two months have passed and the information I left with them has been distorted. Do not stay at this hotel. They are incompetent and untrustworthy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RR_Aruba
Reviews.Content: We stayed before and after our trip to the Mediterrenean. It was a nice clean hotel, in a great safe location. I will for sure stay back at this hotel. Its near all mayor Barcelona attraction, shopping and some monuments, e.o. Bus Turistica, Las Rablas, Paseo de la Gracia, some of Gaudi Masterpieces in walking distance. We stay there with my husband, daugther of 4 and my self. It's a European Standard 4 star hotel, so I knew what I will get when booking. So nothing to complain and we will definitly stay back.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible rooms, only good location”
Reviews.Author: Kate515
Reviews.Content: On the first night we got a room on 1st floor where there was a wall directly behind a window. On the second night we ask for change and it got better but overall not worth to stay longer than a sleep and run away. Do not advise for romatic weekend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Delicious breakfast - great location.”
Reviews.Author: Theodora-x
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location with Casa Balto, Casa Mia, Plaça de Catalunya and La Rambla all within 5 minute walking distance with good public transport to all other sites. The rooms are a good size and the beds are comfortable. The hotel is clean but the only downside would be the overuse of chlorine/bleach which can be smelled throughout the hotel. Breakfast is delicious which a large variety available. The staff are friendly and very helpful. There is also good free wireless throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rony C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent. The location is the best. Very clean. The people on the front desk ALWAYS smiling and helping. All te advises that I got were very helpfull and correct. Just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A PERFECT TEN / A DEDICATION”
Reviews.Author: dariuskakalia
Reviews.Content: Friday… September 09, 2011… the Astoria Palace Hotel, Valencia… 5 am… departure time, within forty five minutes….onward to the Acta Atrium Palace, Barcelona…the supremely elegant district of L 'Eixample…<oh that snob and his elitist pretensions…fancy forsaking ‘atmospheric’ havens such as Las Ramblas, El Born and Raval in favour of Madrid’s hoity toity Salamanca Barrio equivalent…>…the sneers…the jeers…my sixth-sense had sent off an immediate alert…<hell, man I owe luxury, comfort and a stellar location to no one but myself…let ‘em titter…it’s my money, my call…no explanations or justifications are due…tough!>…steely determination…620 euros for five nights…double-room…sans breakfast - never mind!....had loved the look and feel of the property on Booking.com…my heart was set…Acta Atrium Palace it had to be for my second visit to Barcelona after 2007….also, to be within walking distance of the sublime Casa Mila- a ‘wave’- seemingly endless, on the fathomless ‘sea’ of eternity… Senor Gaudi at his most creative….what privilege!... L ‘Eixample, nothing but a hub of fashionable stores and upscale restaurants ? … Casa Batllo, Casa Lleo Morera, Casa Amatller, Casa Calvet, Palau del Baro de Quadras, La Sagrada Familia and a thousand other specimens of exceptional architectural merit? … <derision has to have some intelligence to it…some ground in reality…> …sigh! …thank God, for age and maturity, heralding and consolidating in the process an exceedingly high ‘tolerance’ level…. the secret of co-existence! … Sipping coffee in the lobby of the Astoria Palace - boy, what a terrific choice, endorsed by La Superba, Caballe, no one less - moltes gracies Senora, your taste and selection are both impeccable…silently humming O Mio Babbino Caro - a ‘symbolic’ tribute of gratitude to the Bel Canto Goddess, my mind threw up further recollections…it was to be the Hotel Espana, initially…by the time I managed to get my act in order, the price had escalated to a staggering sum of 900 euros for five nights…out of league….there was Valencia to consider along with Zaragoza, Teruel, Madrid and Munich of course…the costing factor had to be tightly controlled….the Acta Atrium Palace seemed to be the best bet in a city where hotel accommodation is known to get phenomenally expensive….a telephone call - what a warm, friendly and welcoming reception, clinched the deal and there was no looking back thereafter…I had mentally visualized the location without the least bit of difficulty and was mighty thrilled about it…away from Las Ramblas...thank God for small mercies…in the heart of classy ‘Eixample…a new ‘world’ altogether... <God, just why am I feeling so damn uncomfortable?>…tugging at my T shirt <it’s that wretched money belt…now I get it>…all those horror stories about Barcelona - the thieves, the pickpockets, the petty crooks, the scam-champs…to be subjected to a ceaseless onslaught of such 'thrilling' disclosures on our TA forum, morning, noon and night….enough to transform a seasoned, confident traveler into a paranoid ninny….acting against my sound and better judgment, I had gotten hold of this ‘safety-apparatus’ from the El Corte Ingles store opposite the magnificent Arts and Sciences complex…. 20 bucks….grrrr! …the right fit, the right colour… a ‘trial’ followed…high- voltage histrionics….yours truly, masquerading as the terrified tourist , endeavouring to conceal the 'treasure' from hunting - eyes; the hysterically spent sales girl, enacting the role of the ever- vigilant pickpocket…verdict:<lost case, let him go, can detect nothing on him!>…Manuel doubled up at the narration, faithfully reproduced from memory….my poor Barna…such an unfair picture…so far removed from reality…all those exaggerated forum posts….really… <Estacion de Norte is just round the corner, Manuel….barely five minutes…aren’t we a bit early for the taxi?>….Manuel, raising his eyebrows in alarm <Estacion de Norte,are you sure?>…fishing out the print-out of my on-line Renfe ticket, I noticed the point of departure perhaps for the first time…<Joaquin Sorolla…. Good Heavens!>….my reassuring Catalan friend < don’t panic…I see a taxi stationed outside the hotel…no need to wait for the one intended…you’ll make it>…. no more tomfoolery….departure it had to be to … with a heavy heart…<God, plz don’t make it so difficult>…plea rejected! …<destined to be miserable..>…weary resignation! … Joaquin Sorolla…finally…the Euromed to Barcelona Sants…a very comfortable three hour journey… reminiscences-bittersweet ; associations - deeply cherished ….flashback to 2007…my first-ever trip to the Catalan city….one which had been nearly ruined thanks to the mean and disdainful attitude of the hotel, I happened to occupy some meters away from the Ramblas…. I had almost vowed never to return…. had loved the city….loved it very dearly, but somehow never felt loved or accepted in return…a one-sided ardour….flashback to 2010….the TA forum...the same story….always an outsider….one to be wary of… till Chris-the-Scotsman happened….he believed in me and my love for Barcelona… my anchor and support-system, when things would turn dreadfully wrong….my very dear and precious friend, who had enriched my life beyond measure, even if it was destined to be for a short while….with his death, a part of me died too…Barcelona it had to be…a mission remained to be completed…. From Barcelona Sants to the taxi stand….a cakewalk….where were those lurking criminals?... ….Barna is safe….exceedingly safe…shame on those who taint the city so mercilessly.....Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes….the Acta Atrium Palace at last ….smaller and more intimately laid out than Valencia’s Astoria Palace….classical elegance meeting sleek modernity….my first impression upon entering the hotel…within the flash of a second my belongings were attended to…it was Sergi…Mercedes Alcaraz - the Reservations Manager switching from Castellano to Catala to English…all within the flash of a second too! … “Buenos dias ; bon dia ; good day” …. “muchas gracias ; moltes gracies ; thank you very much”, set to endearing effect with a dazzler of a smile and eyes which shone and sparkled with sincerity and genuine warmth….a surge of happiness overtook me…<the Catalan components of my Spanish 'family'>...a sense of immediate belonging and identification…a city and property I was going to cherish above all the others visited in 2011…check- in time was 3 pm…it must have been 9.30 in the morning then…Mercedes read me like a book <you look so tired, the train journey from Valencia being such a long one…please give us some time….five families have just vacated and your room should be with you shortly>...relieved….Catalan kindness….darling Mercedes, such an exceptional woman….my respect and regard for her was to grow with each passing day… Sauntering out of the hotel into the fresh September air, the leafy boulevards of L’Eixample wore an air of exquisite autumnal charm...Barna looked imposing…larger than life….to Farggi, for some morning - nourishment…returning to the AAP, I plonked myself on the blissfully comfortable sofa of the tastefully done up lobby and dozed off….fatigue…had not slept a wink, the night before in Valencia....a wake-up call(!)...it was Mercedes, “Senor, your room has been readied”…must have been 10.45…such kind and considerate folks <my land, my people…the sky is the limit>…was touched…a thank-you followed…Mercedes, again…pure Catalan goodness, “Senor, you need rest…we are so happy to provide the room earlier….for us your comfort is of foremost importance”… smiling contentedly, made my way to the elevator and the 4th Floor….the double room awaiting the weary traveler was wonderfully equipped with every amenity under the sun…the queen-size bed complete with foam pillows and accompanying cushions had been so beautifully prepared that I almost felt guilty of ‘sinking-in’! …the air conditioning – mandatory for Spain…faultless…a suitcase rack, writing desk and chair with Plasma TV, a mini bar with all the expected essentials such as mineral water, Coke, bottled fruit juice, Cava, Beer and chips…a wardrobe with an ample supply of hangers - extra pillows and blankets too, added features including a built-in iron and board , a shoehorn, shoeshine and a digitally operated safety deposit box…free internet connectivity- that too eminently functional - a God sent!...the marbled bathroom….near-perfect…the shower would merit an eight out of ten! …the water- pressure could have been more vigorous.... a very generous supply of toiletries- toothpaste with brush, soap, shampoo, cotton swaps, disposable razors, tissues, comb and shower cap… a separate wash basin with mirror opposite the wardrobe….unusual…bathrobes and slippers at hand below….the cream and brown theme-shading, imparting a glow of subtlety to the room….620 euros? ….a steal…thank you, Booking.com! …. Revivified after all this pampering and some much needed sleep it was time to rediscover the city…9.30 pm… my steps went back to all those treasured spots…the Moderniste marvels….ah, Casa Mila - eternally beautiful!...the Barri Gotic…Port Vell…Rambla del Mar…navigating the waters of the Mediterranean with the poise of an Empress, there stood Barcelona before me…perched-unrivalled on her pedestal of glory….a city blessed with ‘everything’…it was a homecoming….the hand of Chris…guiding and guarding me throughout…pre-destined?.... L’Eixample and the Acta Atrium Palace both helped me in no small measure to discover what DE BennyMalaga often writes about- the highly ‘educated’, refined, cultured and sophisticated section of the city…people-elegant in manners, liberal in thought, tolerant in speech and ideology….those in the tourist trade, so receptive to the needs of the traveller….<what elitism, just hear the snoot>… sixth-sense again….tough…don’t have to hold my ‘impressions’ accountable to anyone…. The Atrium Palace….a model four star establishment…made all the more special by those responsible for running the show on a day to day basis- Mercedes, Sergi, Oscar, Maximiliano, David, Gorka and Zen….a wonderful team….Mercedes <you are not a guest Senor, you are one of us>….on teasing her about her tri-lingual abilities <it is my culture, Senor…it teaches me to impart respect>….thanks to her suggestion, I utilized the swimming pool/ sauna/jacuzzi and gymnasium facility located in the basement of the hotel….lovely pool.. would usually have it all to myself…the swim would do me a world of good…never utilized the laundry service but did hear other guests speak of it in complimentary terms….my address in Barcelona for all future visits….my city…my people…my Catalan family…through your eyes and heart, Chris…I know you are reading every word of this….just the way you were there throughout my supplication in Santa Maria del Mar….Slatkin is convinced….so am I …. ‘Timshel’…. ‘Thou Mayest’…The New Testament….a Divine empowerment….we have it in us to make that vital difference….the 'choice' is ours... and this review is a heart-felt dedication to those who have ‘chosen’ and succeeded thereafter in making that 'vital' difference – Gigis_mum, Benny, Ati, Holakjs, Hubie, JoseAntonio and Belsaita.....for my friend, the Scotsman....in loving memoriam....each sentence, each syllable...forever missed...forever remembered.... Zaragoza and the Hotel Goya….the fourth link….any takers? ….shhhh…. ‘Timshel’….bear in mind….always…

Reviews.Title: “Hard bed!”
Reviews.Author: HK4951
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasant looking hotel but fell down in one vital aspect - the bed was so hard that I could hardly sleep and woke after just two hours with pain in both hips due to the hard mattress. My husband managed to sleep but he said he was not comfortable. When I raised this with the staff on checking out early the next morning for a flight they acknowledged that the hard beds were a problem for quite a few people and offered me a 10% discount. They also told me that they had a soft mattress topper if I had asked for it! How was I to know that the bed was so hard as to be unsleepable before I got in. Why didn't they offer it to me first or best of all why don't they just install comfortable beds? For a 4 star hotel it was absolutely not acceptable. In short, the hotel looks fine and is in a nice area of the city but if you need a comfortable bed to sleep in, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome guests”
Reviews.Author: CLPRtravel
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we felt like welcome guests. Staff were so obliging helping us to get the most suitable room etc. Internet access, storage of cases and use of the small leisure facilities were all included unlike some hotels. Breakfast buffet was fabulous, although weekend staff were over zealous at clearing away during the meal so kept finding things you were about to eat or drink had gone so couldn't relax. Little noisy at night with the traffic at the front as it is on a big main road. However we thoroughly recommend this well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Fredotty
Reviews.Content: A great hotel located within easy access of the metro and walking along Passeig de Gracia. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful and made for a memorable visit to Barcelona. Breakfast can be expensive but it is plentiful and varied. Very well priced for the amenities supplied.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: tinastravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended in Frommer's. Great location, outstanding staff, excellent room. We arrived at 7am on a Sunday morning and the staff did everything to accommodate us so we could get checked in early.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Jaxton_11
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here and it was perfect. Very close to main squares and buses, including airport bus stop, lovely staff and WONDERFUL breakfast - more than we could possibly eat. Recommend you pay the extra to include breakfasts! The pool is TINY, hardly worth going, but apart from that it could not be faulted. We really appreciated the free computers/nternet (and printing, if you ask the staff).

Reviews.Title: “Prime Barcelona Location”
Reviews.Author: Eastwind99
Reviews.Content: The Atrium Palace was in a perfect central location for our week's stay in Barcelona. Placa Catalunya is two blocks away and the Passeig de Gracia metro stop allows one to use the subway as well as middle distance trains to places like Girona, Figueres, Sitges and Tarragona. Walking is an option to almost every part of the city and metered taxis are widely available. There is much to like about the Atrium Palace itself: * The front desk staff is friendly, attentive, knowledgeable and extremely helpful. No request is too small or mundane. * The all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet @ 12.90 EU is to die for with a broad selection of quality meats, cheeses, fresh fruit, eggs, bread/rolls, pastries, and an array of drinks from coffee, juices, cava, wine, sparking water, etc. The serrano ham is worth the price of admission and you won't find better tomatoes anywhere, period. * Did I mention the location, location, location? * There is free WiFi throughout the hotel and also a business center with two free computers for guests. Nice not be gouged as many other hotels do. I was able to bring a U.S. iPhone and use the WiFi for e-mail, Internet and Skype calls. * The basement has a small pool, Jacuzzi with powerful jets (not always hot enough though) and an exercise room with limited equipment. Since most European hotels don't provide these type facilities, this was a plus in our book. Downsides: * Depending on where your room is (front or back), there is some noise. Many reviews have overblown the noise -- in our opinion -- at the back from school kids and sports activities. If you leave the windows closed, there is really not a major problem sleeping. Remember the primo location in a big city if the traffic noise is a problem. We do like to sleep with the windows open if possible which to be frank was tough some nights when the games would go on late. * The double bed was hard and too thin. Not a surprise in Europe, but not up to the standards of hotels in the US and other countries which are upgrading their in-room experience. * The bath tub looked like it had had some type of friction strips on the bottom at some point but I found it extremely slippery (my wife disagreed) and it is an area for improvement. Bottom Line: I have rated 4 only because my spouse complained about her sleep experience. A fairer rating would be 4.5. Should you choose the Atrium Place, you will not have regrets afterwards and it will make your visit to Barcelona a more pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “" Nice hotel in nice area "”
Reviews.Author: funladez
Reviews.Content: We pick this hotel after we read a few reviews, & I am glad. We arrived at the hotel early after a long flight and the hotel let us check in early.The gentleman that check us in sorry i can't remember his name was very helpful & polite.The hotel is modern in a nice area a few blocks to shops & restaurant. The hotel staff was always helpful,professional, polite. The hotel room was very clean, I like the slippers & bathrobes a nice addition. The only thing I didn't care for was the bed. I will stay here again when I come back to Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: pasadena4
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel during July and were very pleased with our stay. The staff was professional and welcoming and spoke perfect English . Our room was immaculate. The marble bath, complimentary bathrobes and slippers, iron/ironing board and an additional sink in the bedroom were pleasant surprises. The hotel is within walking distance of the shopping areas on Passeig de Gracia and a nearby metro stop. It is also close to the Ramblas. Since we took the bus from the airport, we also appreciated the hotel's close proximity to the bus stop in the Plaza. Lastly, we enjoyed the convenient cafe restaurant adjacent to the hotel for its breakfast and lunch buffets.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: andy7070
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel very late Thursday 1st September and the lady at the front desk was most helpful and very professional and polite. She explained the procedures in the hotel, providing where to go in Barcelona and what to do with a map..The room was very nice and was well air conditioned with temperature control if required. The hotel is very close to the Metro Stations and are very safe to use as is the area to walk around, but like most major cities you still have to be cautious with your wallet and handbag...The Spa and Swimming Pool in the hotel were fantastic as was the Sauna..the Jacuzzi was fantastic also, but we found it a little on the cold side, but do not let that put you off, because all in all the facilities were fantastic...The staff were very polite both day and night and spoke fantastic English. All in all we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to other couples..We did not have breakfast at the hotel as we wanted to explore the cities cafes/bars ourselves so cannot comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered at the Palace”
Reviews.Author: Jay G
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days in Barcelona and we chose the Acta Atrium Palace for its location and we loved the look of it. We were there for a celebration and i requested a few things to help us celebrate it before we went, they were very helpful and sorted everything out with no problems, price was also very good. Over all the hotel was perfect for us and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definetly stay here again next time we are in Barcelona. Hotel is very central and within walking distance to Las Ramblas and Passeig de Gracia (main shopping, restaurants and tourist routes) but i would recommend bringing good walking shoes as you can get distracted a lot and walking further than you planned but all good, we found lots of places not on the main tourist maps. Breakfast was a buffet with everything you can think of (chips for breakfast?) but everything is freshly prepared and the staff are very helpful if there is anything you need. Room is large and very clean, very comfy double bed. mini bar, seats and desk, TV only had 2 english channels though and they were CNN & BBC News but we didnt really have time for watching much tv. Bathroom is nice and spacious with large mirror and shaving mirror, shower is fantastic!! We had a balcony with table and 2 chairs and outside lights for evenings. We looked out on to houses and a school but it was very quite and private. Room was keeped very clean and towels changed everyday if we wanted. Bathrobes and slipers were also provide for the spa, we only used the pool & Jacuzzi though. Pool was small so only really 2 people could swim freely at a time. Jacuzzi could have been warmer though. They only had Pizzas on there room service menu but they were delicious and we had them a couple of nights!! Great as we walked for miles a couple of days and it was good just to put our feet up and eat pizza in the comfort of our room. Mini bar have a small range of things but enough for a quite one in. If you do want to eat out i would recommend O'Pinyeiro Bar Bodega (about 2 min walk from Hotel) food is lovely, i had the cod and veg rossioto all i can say is OMG!! It was D I licious!! We would recommend the Cable Cars/Teleferic de Montjuic/Trams great views of the whole city 360 degrees. All in all it was a great holiday for us both.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking facilities and constant subway noise.”
Reviews.Author: DoesntFlyJetStar
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a business centre with two old computers and old browsers installed. There is no printer, so you have to email them the document if you want it printed, which can take some time as they have "email problems". Don't worry if the information is confidential, I'm sure you can trust them... You can't do your own laundry if you want to, and there is no laundromat nearby. If you have a suitcase full of clothes then it is at least a hundred euro or more. The hallway on level three smells. Every five to ten minutes the whole room shakes and the glass rattles due to the subway going through underneath.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MrK2020
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ActaAtrium last year and loved it was a perfect base in Barcelona walking distance to all sites Rooms clean very spacious and extremely spacious Robes and slippers provided!!!!! Heated bathroom mirror - nice touch no misting for after shower shave! The staff welcoming and friendly - We hired a car to travel to Stiges for the day reception couldn't have helped more. Car delivered to reception following day at a good price.... and collected Most definitely recommend this hotel and next time I am in Barcelona I will be staying here.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: The city south of the USA
Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoeBl
Reviews.Content: Smaller, more personal hotel in a great location with very helpful staff. My beige shorts came out of my suitcase with a horrible stain on it. We left it with Oscar before we went to dinner at the tapas restaurant he suggested. By the time we returned from dinner, it was washed and ironed. Try and get that at another hotel! We stayed in a front facing room with a balcony. Very little traffic noise could be heard. The room itself is compact but very modern and spotlessly clean. They had a cruise rate which we used as well. After the cruise, we returned and had a rear facing room which was much larger. It does overlook a kids' playground so it might be noisier later in the year when the kids return. Yes the mattresses are firm but quite excellent for sleeping as far as I am concerned. Much better than a hotel mattress that sags badly! The buffet breakfast is outstanding and at a good price. Excellent quality food, well-prepared. We ate so much that we did not need to eat lunch. Wifi is free and of good speed. Skype worked well on it. PS. You won't believe this---a Scotsman speaking Spanish as one of the front desk clerks in this Barcelona hotel. <LOL>

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: namrogo
Reviews.Content: Check in staff were well-mannered and pleasant. Next day, reception manager Zen described his own staff as "talking rubbish" when he said he could change our room. Also told us we could look for another hotel if we didn't like our room. First time any hotel staff have spoken to us like this. Not exactly 4* standard service. Drilling and other maintenance going on on same floor. Walls are paper-thin, guest in next room made endless noise one morning... Pool extremely small, under maintenance. Restaurant very basic. The room: no tea/coffee making facilities, no English channels on TV, bed rock-hard, fairly small. Definitely not 4* standard. Felt unwanted and unfairly treated. Would NEVER stay in another Acta hotel. I have no idea why this hotel is rated 4*.

Reviews.Title: “What's all the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: pipman55
Reviews.Content: I feel I have to write and offer a fair and balanced view with regard to previous reviewers comments on the 'noisy' children at the rear of the hotel. We stayed in early July and were given a room at the rear of the hotel on the fourth floor, we were slightly trepidatious because we too had read some negative reviews. It is true to say that there is a kindegarten and some sports pitches in the courtyard at the rear of the hotel but we did not find that the children who played there, for only a relatively short period each day, were excessively noisy and in fact as grandparents ourselves we thought it really quite pleasant to hear the sound of young children playing. Also, if the window was closed for air conditioning purposes, you could hardly hear them at all. So, we had a very pleasant 5 day break at the Atrium Palace. The location is good and central and within walking distance to the Ramblas and Playa Catalanya yet its in a relatively quiet area. The reception staff were extremely friendly, helpful and polite and the breakfast in the restaurant each morning was first class. The room we stayed in was very comfortable, and my only 'niggle' was that it would have been nice to have had an English speaking News channel on the television. We loved Barcelona and the hotel and will return to both.

Reviews.Title: “So-so at the Barcelona Atrium Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Persian_Bride
Reviews.Content: We requested a room in the front of the building with a balcony and were promised one when I emailed them ahead of time. The reviews which I read on Trip Advisor warned us of the noisy schoolyard in the back of the hotel. When we arrived, the front desk clerk said they didn't have one available at that moment but we were told that they would have one available within the hour if we'd like to wait maybe in their small coffee shop. We checked back with the front desk clerk about a half-hour later and were told then that they did have one room left but had given it to another guest. Since were were exhausted from our trip, we opted to take our chances with a room in the back of the hotel. Unfortunately, it was just as the review stated! It was so noisy & excessively loud even though the windows were tightly closed! Every morning and afternoon, school kids were out playing in the courtyard and the noise was unbearable. Now we can tolerate some noise, but this was absolutely ridiculously loud! After traveling across the Atlantic on a 9 hour flight, having jet lag and wanting to catch a nap as well as wanting to sleep in the next morning until at least 9 am, who in their right minds want to listen to a lot of kids yelling and screaming? We were very disappointed with the hotel staff not wanting to accomodate us, esp. since we had notified them of our requests before our trip and expected that we'd have a room after being promised one when we arrived. Although the hotel was in a very desirable neighborhood with close proximity to great shopping and restaurants as well as their location being within walking distance to Playa Catalanya and Las Ramblas, I most definitely will plan on staying someplace else on our next trip to Barcelona. Their little cafe was adequate but there's a very limited menu and they're only open in the morning and for a few hours in the afternoon. The breakfast buffet, I must say, was phenomenal and that's held just off the cafe. I must say though, the food was great as was the service. the hotel staff were very friendly and although we did have problems in getting the room we requested, they did give us vouchers for a free breakfast everyday for both my husband and I. I just wish we could have had a better room that was in a less noisy area of the hotel so we didn't feel so tired everyday of our stay! So, if you don't mind kids yelling and screaming in the morning or later afternoon, go for it and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and so convenient”
Reviews.Author: bookwormCumbria
Reviews.Content: we picked this hotel because it had a pool and unfortunately this was the only diappointment as it was so small, however everything else was good. we had a 6th floor room with balcony over the road which was lovely. My husband would sit out there and read in the evening. We found it was only about 5-10 minutes from Las Ramblas and more importantly for us just 3 minutes walk from a fantastic restaurant in a Gaudi building! Casa Calvet was fantastic both for food and atmosphere. The staff in the hotel were very helpful and friendly and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “4th time at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdhub
Reviews.Content: Great location. Staff were so helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them. Buffet breakfast was fantastic, great selection. Very close to the station to pick up the train to Montmelo. Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeslieC_10
Reviews.Content: Clean, contemporary, great value, great central location, nice modern bathroom, central but in the upscale area of L'Eixmple. Friendly helpful front desk staff. We loved our sound proof french doors and balcony facing the Gran Via, wide avenue. Breakfast room looked nice though we didn't eat there due to early morning flight. Free use of computer. Exactly what I wanted!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: dezzib2001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. The hotel is centrally located just a couple of minutes walk from the Placa de Catalunya which is the arrival/departure stop for the airport shuttle as well as the main stop for the tourist sightseeing bus. The hotel itself is lovely and the staff attentive and helpful without being at all overbearing. I would certainly use this hotel again. The only complaint I would have is that the beds are a little too hard for my taste!

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona trip”
Reviews.Author: Pitufa17
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, great location, close to main attractions, and easy access to subway stations and bus stops (only 2 blocks away). Never tried the restaurant inside the hotel so I can't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great service and staff, made all the difference - BRAVO!”
Reviews.Author: JP_Toronto
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent - not far from LAS RAMBLAS, Palau de la Musica (gorgeous concert hall where we attended a guitar recital), the Opera House, and a longer walk to the spectacular Sagrada Familia, a MUST-SEE in this city. Many superb restaurants in the vicinity including El Tunel D'en Marc Palou on Carrer Bailén, - another gem recommended by the staff. My daughter and I were very comfortable, the room was clean and quiet (despite being on Gran Via, and almost a home away from home!! I really cannot stop talking about the Customer service from the staff at the Reception Desk - they were kind, efficient, multi-lingual and went way beyond the call of duty. Thank you Zen, Mercedes, David, Oscar - we will return and send many friends your way. Jennifer and Sabrina

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: gomesvm
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience by staying 6 nights in this hotel. The personnel was very kind and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. The location is very appropriate for moving by bus, metro or walking to anywhere. It is two blocks far from the Rambla street but in an elegant area in Eixample. The wireless access was working very well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, bit noisy, but great location”
Reviews.Author: GHbird
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4 day city break in April. We had a great time and were mainly pleased with the hotel. The rooms were clean and well maintained, it had a 'posh' feel to it. Only problem for us was that our room (308) backed onto a school playground, running very noisy football gamesa nd events outside all day long, and then an adult football team played in the evenings. Not great for an afternoon siesta, or a lay-in as they started by 9am each day. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful and the man in the cafe/restaurant attached was happy for us to buy tea/coffees and take them up to our room, as there are no tea/coffee facilities in the room. The location is great, it is not on the main 'La Rambla' strip but only about 5 minutes walk away, so you can easily pop there when you want touristy stuff and restaurants, ice creams etc. but you can also get away from the noise in the evening. The hotel is also right next to the metro stop which is very handy for exploring further.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, beautiful hotel in excellent location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cordy3-11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying 3 nights at this beautiful hotel. This is our fifth visit to Barcelona and this is definitely the BEST hotel we,ve stayed at.. Check in was swift and every effort was made to make us welcome and inform us of lots of helpful information. Our double rooms were spotless, and we loved the extra touches. The staff were so polite and greeted us in a lovely manner when we came and went. One of the best features of this hotel is its location. Its near enough to the atmostpheric Catalunya Square and Las Ramblas but a good enough distance for peace and quiet. Considering the hotel is located on busy road, we heard no noise in our room at front of building. Can,t say enough, so pleased and have had a gorgeous break. As yearly city visitors to Barcelona we would not hesitate to re-book Actra Atrium Palace. Check out and paying was such a swift and easy transaction, the staff member split our bills and quickly sorted everything out. Excellent rates, location and beautiful rooms, what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely come back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel1989_NL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 days (in March 2011) with my girlfriend. We had an absolutely wonderfull time there! -Staff: GREAT! very helpfull and friendly -Room: GREAT! nice and clean, plenty of space for the 2 of us. -Location: GREAT! right in the center of Barcelona, surrounded by shops, restaurants, and the metro and bus stop were literallyy 2 minutes away. -Breakfast: GREAT! plenty of choice. Worth every penny. I have to say, the only negative aspect of our time at this hotel was the airconditioning. -Temperature: POOR. The room was heated up WAY to much for this time of year.. Also, the airconditioning did work, but dindt help much. We dindt complain about this, because we dindt spend much time in the room at daytime (shopping, visiting other things) The rest was absolutely brilliant! We will definitely come back to this wonderfull hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: IvorNL
Reviews.Content: We were hotel hopping and stayed at this hotel only one day, but would definitely stay there again! Requested a room at the front because they have a balcony.. there's some noise from outside, but it's mostly defeated by double glazing and good isolation. However there's a lot of noise from other rooms (thin walls).. this might be an issue to some.. Design and interior of the room wasn't special (even slightly outdated), but the room was clean, spacy and and sufficient. The best thing about this hotel was the service from the people working there.. they were very friendly, gave a lot of info and always smiled :) The best thing was the day we left, we left the luggage at the hotel while going out.. The guy at reception noticed we had a bag of beers and asked if we would like them to store the bag in the refrigerator.. Priceless! To cut it short, good value for money, clean, good location, slightly noisy and perfect service :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: IanPerthshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in February 2010 for five nights. This hotel is situated only a few minutes walk from place de catalunya, which is the main tourist in the city centre of Barcelona. The hotel is located in prime location for visiting many of the city's tourist attractions, including the Sagradia Famillia, La Pedrera, La Rambla and the Casa Batllo, many of which can be visited from the hotel by foot. The Camp Nou, is only a 55 minute walk from the hotel or a short bus ride along the avenue Diagonal. The passage de gracia is only 2 minute walk from the hotel, which is home to the Casa Batllo and Gaudi designed La Pedrera. This hotel is perfect for a short stay in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: janejarvis
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here....reception staff were great and really friendly.......house keeping was a little amiss.....when we got to our room the beds were not made up, but reception sorted this out very quickly (as we arrived at 2 pm it was not really a problem!). Later in the stay we were left with no blankets, but again, one visit to reception and it was sorted out very quickly. Overall, I would rate this hotel very highly.....great location...we were at the front of the hotel on a busy road...but the double glazing makes this no issue, and if you are there in the summer, you have the air conditioning.....I didn't find the beds any problem....had read previous reviews....a little hard, but not uncomfortable, and we both slept like babies!! A great hotel, great facilities....breakfast was excellent. Reception staff make this place. If you have an issue, they will sort it out!! I recommend it very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a reasonable price considering it's Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Rafael1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and excellently located. Rooms are well kept, some might feel a bit narrow in space but well maintained. Unfortunately, to have the view to the beautiful boulevard in front of the hotel, rates are higher. We had settled for a room giving view to the playgroung of a high school (fortunately for us in August the schools are closed). The spa is a bit small but since it's free, no reason to complain. Service was very friendly and helpful to give tips. The negative point is parking. We paid a bundle in parking for 2 days (70€)...

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FeWalsh30
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a three day stay in barcelona and i would recommend this hotel and this city to anyone. The city is so easy to naviate around for anyone of any age it is well sign posted and things are easy to find. Loads to see and do and great city to walk around and take in the sites and sounds. The hotel is great and centre to everyone, within walking distance from everything. It is only a few mintues walk from where the airport bus drops you off, so saves a money by not having to get taxis anywhere. The hop on hop off bus leaves from the same square and a great way to see the city if you dont want to walk to much which was great for me as a 7 month pregnant women!! The only problems i had with the hotel was the bed which like others have commented on was rock hard which is great for your back but dont be surprised if you dont get a great night sleep and the fact like most european hotels i've stayed in there is no english stations which was a pain as i need to rest a bit and all i had to watch when i was doing this was CNN and eurosports not very enteraining. I was recommended this hotel to stay in and i would recommend it to anyone else, it is so central, its great when they say everything within walking distance they mean it which more than likely isnt the case when you get there. Like others we had the room that over looked the school but there was no noise once the school closed which was grand as we out exploring the city most of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: PaphosThalia
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at this nice hotel between 2 - 6 February. The location is ideal for anyone who is looking central location. Metro is very close and within 5 minutes you reach Cataloni platza. All reception staff is very friendly and unprofessional. It is expensive hotel but it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff but disappointing spa and noisy corridors.”
Reviews.Author: Murchieson
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff but the hotel was a little scuffed and in need of some TLC. We specifically chose this hotel because it had a spa but were disappointed that the jacuzzi was so cold. The room was on the small side and ours looked out over a noisy school playground. The corridors were also very noisy and it sometimes felt like people were actually inside our room!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel - Good Location - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: BinThereAteThat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Christmas - comfortable business hotel located in the Heart of Barca. Worth the 4 Stars, everything worked fine, good breakfast hot & cold buffet. Extra plus - great staff (who helped enormously during a minor emergency; including acting as unpaid translator for a in-room consultation with a Spainish doctor which they arranged....on Boxing Day) Unreservedly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a nice way to start our 14 day cruise back to Miami.”
Reviews.Author: RBM_1945
Reviews.Content: We went early to see Barcelona & the hotel was recommended by Celebrity Cruises. The staff (Yousar & Victor ) at the front desk were very helpful with advice where to eat & things to do in beautiful Barcelona. The buffet breakfast, which was included in our room price, was excellent value.The free WiFi was easy to activate & was a welcome benefit from the hotel. The location was good to get around the city & close to the town square to get on the buses & subway. This hotel was a nice way to start our 14 day cruise back to Miami. We will stay here again, the next time we are in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: olsenjakob
Reviews.Content: Very good rooms, plenty of space, nice layout modern/oriental, good bathroom with amenities. We had a room facing the street with a large balcony, which was very nice. Good cleaning, and central, with shopping and restaurants nearby. Breakfast, and restaurant, below average though.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: HampshireUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Atrium Palace for a week. I was in Barcelona for business. I would rate this as a very good 3 star hotel. My room was very good. Lovely bathroom, balcony, flat screen TV. Bed was too hard for me - poor mattress - which lead to an uncomfortable sleep. There is a very small pool and jacuzzi in the basement. There's a gym too but the room temperature was way too hot for me to use. Anyway there was so much walking to do around Bracelona that I just didnt get out the gym gear. The hotel is on a very busy major road in Barcelona but the windows keep out the noise well so you dont really notice this. The hotel is within walking distance of most things in the centre of Barcelona if you are reasonably fit. Free wi-fi was great. The reception staff are mixed. There was one excellent guy who was born in Scotland who couldn't have been more helpful. Then one day I had the rude female recepetionist that I think others have referred to. Almost made me laugh, she was so outrageously rude! Breakfast is typical of a Spanish hotel. A buffet of mixed food. Beware the taxis in Barcelona - there are a minority of taxi drivers who will do the usual drive round the houses to put up the fare. The worst thing about the taxis is that if you order one from the hotel you will find a surcharge of up to 4.50 Euros added as it was called by phone. This surcharge is shared with the hotel. Rip off. They will also charge you more if you have luggage (why?) and if you are going to the airport and if it is a week-end.... My return jourmey to the airport was charged at 50 Euros!!! A simple and loud protest and a glance at a nearby polieman dropped the charge immediately to 30!! So - get your taxi form the street outside and not via the hotel (great service from the hotel eh?!) and make sure you know how much to expect to pay and the rough journey via a map before your get in. Apart from the taxis evrything else about Barcelona was great - you will have a fab time. I was there to see most of the Merce fectival and am still dancing back in the UK. Enjoy this great city!

Reviews.Title: “Where did the stars come from?”
Reviews.Author: JaneB52
Reviews.Content: Arrived mid afternoon to be greeted by a surly receptionist. My husband was enraged when she tried to photo copy his credit card (Hotel Policy) be warned dont hand it over! Showed to our closet by a helpful bell boy. I was disgusted with the size, cleanliness of the room. I opened the curtains onto a bank of air conditioning units and lost the plot. Straight back to reception (Miss Surley) and demanded a different room. I did get one but again an inside room, however now on the seventh floor with a little natural light, but they may have well just thrown the bed clothes on the floor as the mattress was just as hard. Breakfast was good, small bar expensive as was evening meal. It beggars the question where did the four stars come from. I have stayed in hostels that were brighter, cleaner and with infinitely nicer staff. The only good thing about this hotel is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Exchange Rate”
Reviews.Author: wefstag
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and the staff are generally friendly and helpful, but the room was rather drab and dark. For the price we expected considerably more. But for us the lingering memory will be the way that our bill which was in €uros was converted into £ sterling at an appalling exchange rate without our permission. I've since queried this but was told that I asked to pay in £ sterling. So with the extra we paid the "value for money" rating has slumped further.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant !”
Reviews.Author: Noniem
Reviews.Content: Myself & my teenage son stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in July. Lovely hotel on the Gran Via which is a 10 minute walk from the Ramblas. Staff very friendly & helpful. Room spacious, modern & well equipped.Even though we were at the front of the hotel we were never disturbed by traffic or street noises. Free WiFi is a great facility. The spa is lovely, pool is small but very tranquil & plentiful supply of fresh towels & free water makes the experience a very relaxing one. On the downside there are no english speaking TV stations other then BBC world news & CNN & there is no kettle in the room should you wish to have tea/coffee.

Reviews.Title: “very rood female receptionist 4:45 pm july 15,2010”
Reviews.Author: marinee
Reviews.Content: Never had worse encounter with a staff member in a hotel.Unfriendly ,unhelpful and rood.Possibly ready to get off work @ 5 PM ? Asked her to call a local (Barcelona) number for me,and she refused,even when I offered to pay for the call. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Acta Atrium is NOT a palace!”
Reviews.Author: NoDoze
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Acta Atrium with my spouse and two young kids. We got a great deal from easytobook.com and read other positive reviews especially about accommodating families with young kids. We informed the hotel when we booked online that we would be staying post cruise and would need two baby cots. Upon our 10am arrival we were told our room would be ready at 1PM--no problem we went to sight see as we already knew how to get around. When we returned at after 1 pm we were sent to a dirty room then a room without baby cots. We were sleepy and had to wait 30 minutes for the cots to arrive--our kids were already sleep when they finally arrived. The next morning we went out around 10 am and returned after 3 pm to a dirty room even after placing the please clean this room sign on the door. The hotels only solution was to switch to a clean room while they cleaned our room then switch back again. Great! The air conditioning was losing the battle to heat the entire two days but we just needed to make it a few more hours. Never again would be book our stay at this hotel and caution you as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nicely furnished and above all genuinely 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: lisaWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed here for 4 nights, the reception staff are very nice and nobody bothers you at all. You can come and go as you please and feel you have your own bolt hole to come back to. We did not eat in the restaurant so cannot comment on that but the loction of the hotel is very good, not too central as to be noisy, in fact we were at the rear of the hotel so it was very peaceful. There are no views at the back only over a school which obviously isn't noisy until late, just till about 5pm, time but in a reassuring way. We were lucky enough to be in Barcelona for the world cup semi final and the atmosphere was fantastic and everyone took to the street afterwards to celebrate, wish we had been there for the final! The rooms are a good size, nice bathroom with plenty of shelf space, there are two sinks in the room and good wardrobe space also. The safe is free and there is a flat screen t.v. On the downside not many channels on tv in English, I know you are on holiday but everyone has to rest in between and it's always nice to chill in front of tv when you get in. The other thing is no kettle, we took our own travel kettle so were ok, the mini bar is not drastically overpriced so if you are caught out it is not too expensive. The only room service they seem to do is Pizza but with all those restaurants in Barcelona who needs it! It was our 5th trip to Barcelona and there is still much to see, went to Parc Guell, well worth a visit but it was the only time I was off my guard, being out of the city centre and having just come out of a gift shop passing what I had bought to my husband and not securing my bag for ONE minute I had my purse lifted. I was gutted, not a fortune in it but definitely enough for a meal out etc. they must watch you and wait till you are not concentrating, I am very cautious and have an across the body bag but just one minute of leaving it dangling at my side and my purse was gone, beware folks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Atrium Palace”
Reviews.Author: quanmama
Reviews.Content: We had a nice 4 nights pre-cruise stay at Atrium Palace from June 4 thru June 8. All the staff were courteous and helpful. Upon arrival, one of the staff gave us detailed instructions on how to get to some of the main attractions. We really appreciated that even though we had done lots of research and already knew how to get around. The hotel was very clean and updated. We liked having the 24 hours access to the business center, and we also was given the password to use WiFi on our iPhone which made it even more convenient for us. Food selections were very good at the breakfast buffet, and the food quality was good. We liked the location of the hotel and it was easy for us to walk from the hotel to subway stations and restaurants nearby. The only complain we had was that the room was a bit on the small side. The 3 of us did feel a bit crammed in there but we managed. We heard some noise from the elementary school kids at the back of the hotel but it did not bother us. Also I like to mention that the front desk staff did not note our nightly rate already included breakfast when we booked. They added the extra breakfast charge on our final bill but it was immediately removed after we showed them our booking email. Make sure you bring a copy of the booking email listing what is covered to avoid confusion. Overall we had a nice stay there and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and attractive location”
Reviews.Author: MrBelpit
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nigths in this hotel and I loved my large room with a lot of facilites. The view was out on a backyard and nothing to write home about but that wasn't reason for my stay so that was no problem. The staff was friendly and helpful and the free wifi was excellent. I wouldn't hesitate recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: NAB68
Reviews.Content: Yes this location is very good but thats about the only positive thing I can say. This was our honeymoon and we emailed hotel to advise them this. On check-in we reminded them again and was met with blank faces. So we get to the room and of course no champagne, no flowers nothing to make us feel special. Apparantly this was a good room but we had the cleaning cupboard one side, so everytime the staff needed something they banged and crashed about in there. And then outside our window was a courtyard that belonged to a school, so from 8am to 5pm we had screaming kids outside the window. Overall hotel is a good choice for tourist to barcelona but not for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, efficient hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Lewy8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights prior to a western Mediterranean cruise. The location is excellent. The north end of Las Ramblas was literally 4 blocks away. The front desk staff and bartenders were very friendly and efficient. Rooms vary widely because my room was quite small (typical for European hotels), but our friend's room was huge (They said only one large room per floor, so we chose to be on the same floor instead of separate). The beds were very comfy; the water pressure in the shower was good; and the closet was spacious. In room safe too always makes you feel good too. We used the hot tub and sauna - both were clean and worked well. The only thing we experience some disappointment in was the breakfast. The food selection was good, but the maitre 'd was a real jerk to guests...and not just us. Next time I stay here, I will go out of my way to make him mad, and only because he gets mad so EASY!!! Very disagreeable employee... By the way, Park Guell IS A VISUAL MUST SEE.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SKIpal
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Close to the main area but in a quiter part. The room was lovely, the bathroom great and the reception staff were helpful. If we are lucky enough to come to Barclona again we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jasmine05brighton
Reviews.Content: nice and clean hotel, was a brilliant location happy with most things apart from the size of the pool it was TINY.. just enough room for 2 people which was very dissapointing!! and dont eat or drink from the mini bar well over priced!!

Reviews.Title: “Very positive but not too helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NikolayG
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel for spending a 1 week vacation with my girlfriend. Hotel was chosen for its convenient location and because it has an indoor swimming pool/spa area - nice to have in January. :) We were generally satisfied with the stay. The room was quite pretty and of good size, location is really great for any kind of winter-time activities (i.e. except for sea-bathing), breakfast are really plentiful and very tasty, the hotel has a fair sized indoor swimming pool and a good sauna. Still there were some negative sides as well. WiFi access in the room was mostly not working. The signal strength is quite low and even if you are connected most of the time there's no internet access anyway. Also be aware that with one login/password you can connect only one device at a time. At the same time wired internet access in the "business centre" works good and fast. All the hotel staff is extremely positive and willing to help. At the same time most of reception advices about transport, obtaining tickets etc appeared to be incorrect or, in terms of tickets, valid only for spanish citizens. And the maid, though again very positive and polite, didn't replenish some of the bathroom items. Also be aware, that the hotel restaurant and room service has a very limited choice of "menus" and pizzas and even so most of the time you can't get even the "menu" - only pizzas. Nevertheless the overall impression of the hotel is good and I would stay there again if travelling to Barcelona in wintertime.

Reviews.Title: “NOT GREAT AT ALL!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pji
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for two reasons 1. the location and 2. the indoor pool. The location was good, BUT there are soooo many well located hotels in Barcelona that are less expensive and better valued. The indoor pool was the size of a large bath tub. The hotel indicates an "excercise room" which is not functional and not safe. The temperature in the rooms were not temperate and could not be controlled-- TOO HOT! Leaving you to open windows to the very NOISY STREET! The front desk was not helpful and not knowledgeable at all. They could not make restaurant suggestions or even let us know where a train was located. It was like pulling teeth to get them to even look up anything on the internet. We booked our reservation as a family of five, they put us into 2 rooms with only four beds, and then acted as if it was our fault that we needed another bed. The rooms are average size when speaking of European standards. The only thing that places them as a four star is probably the white terry bathrobes that can be used. This hotel's lack of hospitality was embarrassing. It was a very disappointing stay for Christmas week especially since we spend a lot of money at this hotel. I will say that the breakfast buffet (12 Euros each) was lovely and the staff at the hotel's restaurant was also very well trained and friendly. But it is my opinion, that a hotel needs to offer something more than a good breakfast!!!!

Reviews.Title: “location, location,location”
Reviews.Author: hihiromi
Reviews.Content: great location, good price, only if it was a 3star hotel. room service food was limited to pizza and sandwiches. no porter to carry heavy bags. swimming pool was ok but had to change in your room. free wi-fi was not working for 4days of our stay- for that, no internet in business centre as well cleaning staff just enter our room without even knocking the door. over charged for minibar drinks. still, good location and nice staffs. wouldn't sty again though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price, Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: harrymart
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights in Ocober, pre-cruise. We booked online and got a great rate that included breakfast. We arrived after an all night flight. Having paid for the previous night, we were checked in and in our room quickly (there was no wait at 8:oo AM). This was a good precaution, because we saw later in the morning that other overnight arrivals were camped out in the lobby, waiting for their rooms to be ready. We had a room in the back, which was quiet, and liked the modern decor. Very clean. Only complaint was that the mattress was hard (but we got used to it) and it is a tricky maneuver stepping in and out of the shower (if you are overweight or have vision problems, you might not like the tight shower configuration, if other rooms have the same design.) The business center had free internet access, which was convenient. We enjoyed the American style breakfast buffet - eggs, cheeses, meats , cereals fruits - a good meal fueling us for touring. The staff was very helpful and provided maps and directions. Central to many attractions and the HOHO bus, on a beautiful boulevard. You won't be disappointed. Note: We cabbed it to the cruise pier. We heard later that this is the best way to go - the cruise line charged alot more for transfers. Cabs are plentiful and the pier is 20 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Michelle_Tobin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 1 week in September. Location is great. Staff were so helpful. Rooms were so clean and spacious. Loved the bathrobes and slippers...great touch. Hotel restarurant is not great , but who cares when there are some lovely restaurants within walking distant. Only a few minutes walk from the main square , shops and nightlife. I have recommended this to many others and hopefully when I visit Barcelona again I will stay here. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff let down by paper thin walls...”
Reviews.Author: pyorks
Reviews.Content: Location was great, minutes walk from main centre. Staff in particualr on reception were very friendly and helpfull, the breakfasts were fantastic. A modern conversion that is really let down by the paper thin walls! On our first night we were kept awake from 5am with our neighbour being ill in the adjoining bathroom - we could hear everything we could also hear word for word all their conversations! For this reason, Im afraid we couldnt stay at hotel again. The hotel was clean and modern - we had booked originally as it had an indoor pool - unfortunately it was rather smelly of drains in the basement health area! We loved Barcelona - would have been even better with better sound proofing!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & lovely too”
Reviews.Author: suzeetes
Reviews.Content: Finding a jacuzzi to renew some sore feet & being able to swim in the indoor pool meant revitalization for us after a long day of being a "tourista." The English skills of the staff are excellent & they are very helping with even the smallest questions & suggestions. We were pleased at the location & room too.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: jg12318
Reviews.Content: Sleek European style...staff was knowledgeable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, nice room...horrible beds”
Reviews.Author: SteveMavsFan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and the location is great for any visit to Barcelona. Walking distance to many sights and just a few blocks from some major metro stations so you have easy access to anywhere in the city. The staff at the hotel where great, very friendly and helpful. The only exception was with getting tickets to Barcelona football game. They only wanted to help if you used the ticket agent they worked with and of course they got a cut. They next problem I had was the beds...the problem was it the mattress was JUST A BOX SPRING!!!! Had several others with us and all 3 rooms had this. They where rock hard but we slept great so go figure. Over all I liked this hotel but not sure I wold have been ok with the beds if I had not just flown in from the US so was dead tired.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Lackeen
Reviews.Content: The Atrium Palace is a great base for a break in Barcelona. Just a 5 minute walk to Placa Catalunya from where you can explore the city. The area was still quiet at night. Rooms were lovely. We stayed on the top floor with a view over the Gran Via. The staff were very helpful with recommending restaurants and providing us with adaptors! We got good value on this hotel, and with is great location and just being a lovely hotel in general, we would go back here if we are lucky enough to be in Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Atrium Palace”
Reviews.Author: RichL46
Reviews.Content: On a family vacation with our 2 boys, we had 2 stays at the Atrium Palace. After an all-night flight and an early arrival, we took the Aerobus to Placa Catalayuna. A 10 minute walk and we arrived at the Atrium Palace for our initial 3 night stay. To our surprise, our rooms were ready and we were able to use them for a brief rest before beginning to explore Barcelona. We found the rooms to be comfortable and clean. Some may not like the hardness of the beds, but they were fine for us. As we were resting up, there was some noise from the schoolyard in the back of the hotel, but we were able to get some sleep anyway. The free wi-fi in the room was a big plus for our sons. The location is convenient for walking to many of the attractions of Barcelona and the excellent subway system is nearby. The staff was very helpful whenever we had any questions. Check in and Check out went smoothly for both of our stays. If we return to Barcelona, I would not hesitate to book another stay at the Atrium Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Value, Rooms all Superb”
Reviews.Author: marcymarc24
Reviews.Content: For what you pay this is a great hotel. The location is 5-10 mins walk from the main bus stops. Getting the open top bus tour (about £20) is he best get around for the city as everything is so spread out. Rooms are clean and staff are all helpful. There is a main road outside but with the air con you can shut out the noise and have a good nights kip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel, will return there”
Reviews.Author: goldenoreos
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 6 nights. Hotel staff was great: friendly, helped w/ reservations and recommendations, spoke multiple languages. Rooms were very nice, with plenty of space and were clean. There is a little bit of street noise at night, but not any more than any other big city. We did not use the pool/sauna area, but did get to use their computers to check email/maps every now and again. Location was excellent, just a couple of blocks from Placa de Catalunya where you can catch all kinds of public transportation, and close to Passeig de Gracia and La Rabla - without all the noise. I would definitely go back here and definitely recommend it. Bring your walking shoes and explore this magnificent town!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff were extremley helpful”
Reviews.Author: sunsearcher2009
Reviews.Content: Read some mixed reviews about this hotel, the location is excellent, 2/3 min from metro station, 5 min walk from placa la cataluna and la ramblas. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and could not do enough for us, helped with advise on things to do, how to get their etc. Used the pool, jacuzzi and sauna, they were excellent although the jacuzzi i found a bit cold, they are of course indoor in the basement of the hotel. The rooms are quite roomy and very nicely finished and layed out. Didnt eat in the restaraunt or have breakfast, did have a drink in the bar and again the bar man was very helpful and pleasant. Their is some truth in some of the bad reviews, there is a school at the back and if you like sleeping in in the morning you will find it quite noisy, also the cleaners do make a lot of noise also. One or 2 small cracks in tiles in bathroom and did see one or two very small spiders on floor in room, but it was very warm while we were there, oh and the air conditioning in the room is excellent. Over all i was very pleased with the hotel, we got very good value for money and i would have no hesitations in recommending the hotel to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel , great value , well located”
Reviews.Author: ab500
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and very well located. The rooms were nice and clean . When we reached the hotel we were very warmly welcomed by the hotel staff. The staff at the hotel can speak very good English and they will guide you regarding the area around the hotel and what all there is you can see in Barcelona. You have acsess to free internet at the business center of the hotel . The cab ride from the airport to the hotel will cost you around 30 to 40 Euros. The hotel is located at the city center near the bus stop and the metro. The hotel is just 5 minute walk to the metro as well as the blue and the red line buses. ( hop in and hop off tours )The blue line will take you to the beach where you can find places to eat and if you are in a mood to try your luck , then you can visit the casino which is also in that area. (I would suggest you to buy a 2 day ticket for these bus tours as they will cost less ) This hotel also located just 10 minute walk form the famous la remaballas area. There a lot of places to eat in and around the area . Over all it Barcelona was a very good experience , and we had a very comfortable stay at the hotel. Warning: Be very careful with your belongings while using the subway as there are a lot of pickpockets. Usually they would enter in a group of 3 to 4 people and while exiting the train they will crowd you and one of them will take out your wallet. As this has happened to me, so please be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Central to all Barcelona - great stay”
Reviews.Author: jmwing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Acta Atrium Palace 2 nights during our Spain vacation. It is at the bottom end of the Eixample and close to the metro and placa de catalunya and las ramblas. Our room was clean and spacious. The staff was helpful and polite. Our room was in the back and we could hear schoolchildren playing at lunchtime, but they were not there in evenings. Tips: why eat at a hotel restaurant when there are so many other great ones in the city - Two good ones are Tapas 24 and ciudad condal (both tapas, both 5 min walks). Make sure you go to the boqueria market on las ramblas - best thing to do in town.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: BRCruiser
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this hotel was above and beyond. The rooms were spacious and unlike any other hotels for the price in Europe. It was overlooking a school yard but if you are not in your room during the day (and you shouldn't be because you should be sightseeing in Barcelona) you won't hear any kids having a good time. They had free internet and spoke English as well as recommended good restaurants and gave precise instructions on how to get to places just walking. It also had a whirlpool and swimming pool that were perfect for a bit of relaxation in between the sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Atrium in the middle of a historic city”
Reviews.Author: ScorpioAnu
Reviews.Content: Acta Atrium was a very comfortable hotel right in the heart of the Cataluniya. The staff was very warm although they spoke little English. Cataluniya square was just 5 minutes walk from where you can start your journey by taking a hop-on hop-off bus. The Ramblas starts at this square where you can stroll down the long 5 mile street full of energy and activities. I didn't had a power adaptor but the hotel staff were kind enough to give us one to charge our cameras. Also the hotel provides free water bottles, which helps in an expensive city. Hotel offered free jacuzzi, use of gym, spa and indoor swimming pool. It was say it was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “High Class, Great Location, Memorable Service”
Reviews.Author: jorgeq82
Reviews.Content: Upon returning a 12-day mediterranean cruise onboard Royal Caribbean for our honeymoon, my wife and I booked a one night stay at the Atrium Palace. The hotel was recommended via a cruise line booklet and was quote at a much higher price but fortunately we manage to snatch a great deal through Expedia. $100 for one night. Location is wonderful especially from Plaza Catalunya, where you can easily board a "Hop On Hop Off Tourist Bus" to take in a great and quick feel of the beautiful city. The hotel itself along with room and staff were fantastic. High class at a reasonable price. Elegant rooms, wooden floor, hot tub and they provide you with other amenities that any other other hotel would have charged you initially for. As a frequent traveler, I was mostly impressed coming across a hotel that really does offer FREE Internet Wi-Fi access. You see the signs all the time in places but they always charge you a fee subscription to use it. At the Atrium, all you have to do is inform front desk that you're interested in using the internet and they'll supply you with a username and password that you can later use to navigate the web at absolutely no cost.
