Whether it's on their computer or your laptop. There's a elegant restaurant attached to the hotel that's also very convenient. Beautiful romantic pool and jacuzzi to do away the stress after a long day of touring. My only minor nitpicking of my our experience at the hotel was the the bed was rather hard. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: cas1905
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Acta Atrium Palace Hotel 6 days in May. First, the hotel location was excellent. Right in between the new and old sections of the city. 1/2 block from Metro. Very close to Placa Catalunya. Staff professional, courteous, and helpful when asked. Room was modern, updated, and clean. Bathroom had tub and shower and sink. Also, outside in a little alcove was another sink which we found helpful in the morning. Bathrobe and slippers provided. Excellent toiletriees. We had a room with a huge balcony overlooking the Gran Via. It was very nice but sitting out on the patio was a little noisey due to the traffic. Inside of room very soundproof, no traffic noise heard. Breakfast buffett was enjoyable and sufficient--bacon, eggs, potatoes, rolls, croissants, fruit, meats, cheeses, pastries, cereal, coffee, and juices. We did not use the minbar, but the prices were very reasonable. Also forgot to mention the in room safe, which was a plus. DAughters luggage did not arrive in Barcelona with her and the staff was helpful in calling the airline and interpreting for us and the next day, the bag was placed in our room. We did not use the spa area, but it appeared nice and clean. Hotel also had internet services which we did not use. We enjoyed our stay here and would have no problem staying here again. One other thing. Approximately 10 days before we arrived, I received a nice email from the hotel about our reservations and alot of suggested sites to visit which was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: bruce14
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the start of April. Front facing room on the second floor had significant road noise, manageable with ear plugs, small balcony a nice touch. Good size room, free wireless internet a bonus. Excellent location, easy walk with luggage to/from airport bus, the Ramblas, the shops and restaurants of the Passeig de Gracia. Recommend the hop on/hop off bus for a comprehensive tour of all the city has to offer (we bought the two day pass and covered all three routes)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic location excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: pra130
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at the end of march , lovely hotel spotlessly clean with v helpful staff. Breakfast is expensive but not if you book the inclusive deal in advance. Possible to have a ten course breakfast if you want. Spa facilities are small but very pleasant . The road at the front is very busy but the triple glazing is totally effective and keeps out any noise.Would highly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big Room, Great Location, Free Internet”
Reviews.Author: Chris_n_Christine
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the end of a 3 week tour and this hotel is at the top for recommendations to friends. Our room was really big for european standards, but was in the back near the school, which meant the day always started with loud kids playing outside. That was okay for us since we were up early to sightsee anyhow. The bathroom was also large, and we had a minifridge in the room. From the hotel we were able to walk to La Rambles, the old Roman quarter, and even to Sagrada Familia (though that's a bit far). Hotel is on a tree-lined off shoot of a main road loaded with restaurants. Conceirge was great with recommendations, getting up complimentary umbrellas when it was raining, calling cabs and pointing out things on a map. Added bonus of free computer and internet usage in a business lounge. Has a pool and hot tub in the lowest level (basement) -no windows, darker and small, but relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: LuanneS
Reviews.Content: Our room was great and clean and quiet. Not far from the Les Rambles, The Market, and the trolley stop with a great route to see a large portion of the city. The staff was very helpful and recommended great places for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: whales
Reviews.Content: Was extremely happy with this hotel from the minute we walked in to the minute we left. its the perfect location - just away from the business of las ramblas, yet just a stones throw away. the hotel is spotless, cosy and has everything you need (including little cafe). The staff at reception are very friendly and help you with anything you need. the bedrooms are spacious, and extremely comfy - they provide you with everything - soaps, shampoos, toothpaste/brush/ shoe shine, shower caps, combs, tissues, razor/shave gel, slippers and fluffy robes. We had a front facing bedroom facing the busy road but heard nothing of traffic at all. The pool and jazuzzi is on floor -1 and is is a haven of relaxation - I went down each morning before heading for breakfast and it was pure heaven. The ambience there is fab with soft coloured lighting to sooth. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but we ate in the cafe next door a couple of times (just coffe and crossoint). We did have a couple of mixed drinks on our first night which came to 18 Euro for two drinks which we though was a bit steep. This would be our only complaint. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to couples, families or business travellers - its the height of professionalism and everything you would expect in a hotel. Thanks Atrium for making our break so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: rachelmMonmouthshire
Reviews.Content: we arrived at midnight and checking in was a breeze. we were shown to our room with a smile and nothing was too much trouble. the hotel is fantastic, and the staff were very helpful. the location is fantastic, away from the hustle and bustle but only a 2 minute walk to be right in the centre of barcelona. there are very good restaurants and tapas bars nearby, just ask at the reception desk and they will advise you, even phone through to make your reservation for you. the rooms were very clean and bathrooms were well stocked with anything you may have forgotten. our room was on the front with a balcony overlooking the main road,but the double glazed windows were very effective. i will certainly be staying here again, and would recommend to everyone to just book this hotel and stop trawling through all the reviews as i did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location at great price”
Reviews.Author: calebbrewster
Reviews.Content: This is a high quality boutique hotel in a gilt-edge classy location at a great price. I wasn't sure from the guide books that this would be a good location, but it is; with excellent metro a block away, regional train station three blocks away, and reasonable plentiful cabs and buses right outside the door. Many top restaurants and shopping also nearby at walking distance. Safe, modern, gilt-edged district of Barcelona, a fascinating historic city. Concierge and staff all friendly, knowledgeable and spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Aegeandream
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in this really lovely hotel. The rooms are very nicely decorated, very comfortable, clean and spacious. We had to change rooms after one night as there was renovation work going on in the building next door (nothing to do with the hotel itself) which woke us up at 7.30am in our original room at the back of the hotel. The staff dealt with it very efficiently and we were moved to a room at the front of the hotel for the rest of our stay. It was still a very nice room but was smaller and less well-equipped than the previous room (no second sink or small table) so if I was going back I would request one of the back rooms so long as the building work next door had finished! There was some traffic noise as well at the front although we were on the 5th floor so it wasn't too bad but earplugs are still a good idea. The hotel itself was one of the quietest internally I've ever stayed in, no noise from staff, lifts etc which was great. There are some lovely touches which really make this hotel a 4 star superior in my opinion, they had the most extensive range of toiletries I've ever seen in a hotel (including razor and toothbrushes), bathrobes and slippers in the room, free water (although no tea/coffee making facilities in the room unfortunately) etc. The free wifi is also great although the "interactive TV" was disappointing as you have to pay to use the internet through the tv so bring a laptop! It's in a really excellent location, 5 mins walk from Passeig de Gracia, 10/15 minutes walk to the old city, in a lovely safe area. One tip: we decided to treat ourselves to a taxi to the airport thinking it'd be about €25, it cost €35! The airport bus is only 10 minutes walk away at Catalunya so we'll be taking that next time! We've been to Barcelona a few times and were delighted to find this hotel as we've had mixed experiences with hotels there before. Overall, a great hotel in a fab location!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: melaniebeth
Reviews.Content: Lots of our friends have stayed at this hotel so due to the good reviews me and my boyfriend thought we would stay here for ym 21st birthday. when we came to check in they said they didnt have our booking but luckily there were rooms avaliable. Our room was lovely nice and spacious with a large clean bathroom, loved the bathrobes and toiletries in the room. We had a large balcony which did over look a school yard but the noise didnt affect us or wake us up so this didnt matter and we enjoyed watching the kids play basketball. The bed was very comfy and we LOVED the swimming pool and jacuzzi we had it to ourselves every day which was fab! The hotel is very nicely decorated and well kept and the staff are very friendly. We didnt eat at the hotel as we thought it was a little pricey but the hotel is located centrally so we walked to restaurants and bars during our stay. I would definatly recommend this hotel to couple and families.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Gary06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night prior to a cruise, this seems to be a popular hotel for the cruise lines. The hotel is nice, clean, in an excellent location in the center of town close to everything. We used the nearby Metro station to get around....the Metro is safe, fast, convenient, and easy for visitors to figure out. Our room was in the back which overlooks a school that had basketball and soccer games going until about 8:00pm but actually this was not a distraction and probably quieter than the front which is on a busy street. The only complant we had was with the bed which was poor (you roll to the center) but otherwise everything else fine. Breakfast was included and the quality was excellent. I think this hotel can be a little pricey for what it is, I might stay here again but would also look around at other sites before coming back.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: N_and_R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Apsis Atrium Palace Hotel in Barcelona on two separate nights (one night before our cruise, and one night after the cruise). Our travel agent who booked our cruise also booked this hotel for us. The hotel is located on Gran Via de les Cort Catalanes, about 2 blocks west of Passeig de Gracia. We really liked the location. We stayed in a fairly large room in the front of the hotel with a balcony overlooking the Gran Via on the night before the cruise, and a slightly smaller room facing the back of the hotel (no balcony), with a view of a school on the stay after the cruise. We had the breakfast included on our rate on our first night. We thought the quality and value of the breakfast was excellent. I highly doubt it is possible for someone to grab a quality breakfast for 9 Euro/person anywhere else in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a business stay”
Reviews.Author: London Frequent Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night attending a conference; the organisers booked the room. The hotel is a rather old-fashioned Spanish establishment in a prestigious location on the Gran Via; my front room had some traffic noise from this busy street, though not very obtrusive by Spanish big city standards. The room was not too large, though adequate for an overnight stay. I suspect that you can find better by reading Trip Advisor reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lworthalot
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights before leaving on a cruise vacation. Chose the hotel based on the good reviews on this site. We requested a 2 queen room when we booked about 6 months ago. Upon arrival we were told none were available and were put in a 1 queen room about as big as our closet at home. Bed was the size of a full size..not a queen size. The bathroom floor was granite with 2 tiles broken . The bathroom door would only open about half way before sticking..you had to slide in then close the door. Taking a shower in the bathtub was like showering on a skating rink. Once the tub got wet it was almost impossible to stand up without bracing against the side of the tub. I asked for a rubber mat but only got a strange look for my trouble. Their great restaurant was a joke for dinner though the buffet breakfast was very good. Would not consider staying here again. For the money I expect much more than what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay-Terribly Underrated by TripAdvisor Users”
Reviews.Author: bgold7a
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at Atrium Palce and can not understand the negative reviews. Everything was excellent. Great location, spotless, very helpful staff that checked us in at 7 AM after the over night from JFK. We were a group of 7 and had two rooms, one on 7th floor with balcony/hot tub and one on 6th floor that was a standard double. Note that this hotel gets three starts (out of 3) from Frommer's. I think there is some competitor writing the reviews. For the traveller from Paris to give one star and say that the hotel bar looks like a bodega on a dark side street is just totally false. It is a bright airy place that makes great cappucinos and has excellent bartenders. Breakfast is also excellent, but not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MardiGras46
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights after a cruise. The hotel staff was very helpful and had very good English skills. They handled the luggage very well. The restaurant had a complete breakfast with both American and European style food. The room was very spacious although the bed was not very good, the mattress was extremely hard. The location is excellent and close to many of the main attractions of Barcelona. There are many good restaurants within 15 minutes by walking.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: OpusTheCat
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Atrium Apsis before our Mediterrean cruise and we really liked the property. The location is wonderful. It is a short walk to Placa Catalunya which is central to everything. Our rate for the first two nights was only 122 Euros, which is a great deal for Barcelona. The last two nights it was 170 Euro. This is because the cruise ship booked pre-cruise passengers in this hotel, so I believe it was at capacity for our second two nights. The room was nicely furnished and the bathrooms were excellent. The free business center was great for checking internet email. The only real complaint was the elevators. They were very small and hot, but other than that we thought it was a very nice hotel. We would stay here again if we go back to Barcelona. (Which we loved) You can see our entire trip report with pictures on our sunnytripreports web site.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: stechris
Reviews.Content: Room : problems with hot tube and lavatory ( water leaks ) , Tv remote was out of batteries , electricity stopped for couple times ( also for elevators ) Services : Personnel entered and called numerous times my room. Sometimes without knocking. They looked well intentioned , but not too educated i think. Hotel bar looks more like a bodega on a dark side of an avenue. Location : the only positive thing : it's really close to the center

Reviews.Title: “This hotel 4 stars rating??Not so much... Please read!”
Reviews.Author: lilybelle264
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from our trip from Barcelona and booked a travel agents rate since I'm one. Stayed from June 15 to 17- let me start by saying the location is excellent, centrally located. We purchased the breakfast for half price 8 euros and it was a good deal considering what you get. We arrived hotel after our amazing European cruise visiting Italy, France and Malta. We arrived at 8:30 and Rafael at the front desk was really pleasant and friendly. He told us that the room was not ready which I completly understood he told us that the room will be ready by 12pm. We walked around the Ramblas and frankly I think it is way overrated, way to expensive to eat and shop, go else where for shop and eat, Try The Cortes Ingles restaurants on Plaza de Catalunya the prices are good and the quality is excellent. (On Sundays most of all Barcelona shuts down, shops, supermarkets, ect) Well. going back to the hotel, we went back at 12pm and was assigned room 307 on the 3rd floor, the two elevators are small and hot. The room was ok , there where laminated floors that was installed really sloppy, the moldings around the floors where falling off and not well put together. The bathroom door paneling was peeling off the door and also the bathtub was really slippery and also there was rust building around the parimeters of the tub. The pool and jacuzzi were closed for renovations. Dont let the pool fool you its is really small. Also the beds are awful, the springs where stabing me for 2 nights in a row. Ouch!!! They really need to update their beds. I dont think this hotel deserves a 4 star rating to be honest. Oh by the way room 307 was facing the school yard and that did not bother us at all since the windows are double pane. I think that Apsis Atrium Palace tries but dont deliver. I never got the free water or the juices. Will I stayed there again and recommend this to my clients, I probably will for the really cheap price, other wise I will stay elsewhere pay a little more and get what you deserved based on the price paying per night for hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel did not accomodate our requests”
Reviews.Author: kevinc
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservation 4 months in advance requesting a room at the FRONT of the hotel (read about the school yard in the back) for our recent post cruise 2 night stay. Upon dis-embarking from our cruise ship, arrived at the hotel we were told our room was not ready as the hotel was sold out the night before, check back at 12 noon. We returned at that time and was told our room was still not ready. So we sat and waited. The bellman eventually came by and said the room was ready and handed us the key. We got into a very hot, small, slow elevator, reached the room realizing we were in the rear of the hotel. Yes, the school kids were playing in the courtyard! The room itself was just okay, with laminate floors? The bathroom was nice with the exception of the towel rack in the tub, poorly placed for someone to bang head against. Very dangerous! It was not the room we had requested but we were very tired and wanted to see the beautiful city outside, time was limited and we waited 4 hours for the room. Spent very liitle time in the room but feel we paid too much for this hotel, (even booking in advance) realized after extensive walking around beautiful Barcelona that many other less expensive, same quality hotels are available in similair or better location (travelers take notice!) We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissStress
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on the Gran Via. Our room was at the front overlooking the tree-lined street. It was an excellent location. Initially, I wanted to stay at a hotel right on La Rambla. I'm glad we stayed at the Atrium Palace instead. It was close to everything, but away from the crowds at the same time. Much better choice for us. The hotel offered a free business center with 2 computers available for use. The business center also contained a library of books on local topics. Kudo's on the robes, towels and linens. You can always tell a quality hotel by their towels, and these were thick and the size of beach towels. Very nice. The hotel staff were all very nice and helpful. I can usually find something to complain about, but honestly, this place was great. Okay, I have one complaint, 16 euros for breakfast is way too much, so we ate pastry at the many cafes that are everywhere you look. I know... quite a hardship, right?

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Start to Our Dream Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: couple_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Apsis Atrium Palace for 4 nights and 5 days, and it was the perfect start to our honeymoon. We were in Spain taking a cruise from the Barcelona port. The things we liked about this hotel: - gorgeous location - in walking distance to everything -beautiful pool area -romantic setting -clean and comfortable -free room service (yea, breakfast in bed every single day!) - awesome staff, who speak english and are very willing to help show you around - seconds away from local transportation I cannot rave about this hotel more, it was the best choice we made for our time in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with a great Staff”
Reviews.Author: byrdy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights and loved the hotel. My only complaint was the noisy school children outside in the school yard. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. The breakfast was well above average and we looked forward to it each day. The hotel is well located and an easy walk everywhere. In summary, this is a lovely hotel and a very good value. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure”
Reviews.Author: alwop
Reviews.Content: Everything was just as you would expect from a four-star hotel -- or better! The front-desk staff are very friendly, and I practically had to chase the porter who took up our luggage to give him a tip. The facility looked new and well-maintained (though the elevator ride was a bit bumpy at times). Our room was quite big for a large-city hotel, and everything worked and looked fine. The advertised wireless Internet was fast and reliable. Breakfast was well above average for Spain, with both hot and cold choices, coffee/tea and delicious orange juice and fresh fruit available on the buffet. For our purposes anyway the location couldn't have been better: it's a short walk to Passeig de Gracia, where all the top designers have their shops, and Plaça de España is within walking distance (El Corte Inglès department store is also a a treat). There are plenty of good restaurants in the streets around the hotel. Our best discovery was foc, in Joan de Borbó, just around the corner from the hotel -- perhaps a bit too trendy for some, but with excellent food at extremely reasonable prices. (If you go, save room for the assorted desserts!)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: maverick1234
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for three nights during our vacation in Barcelona. It was simply one of the best hotels that we've ever stayed in. I loved the charming facade of the hotel and was mentally prepared to find a tired looking room but instead, we found a very modern room with impressive fittings. This hotel is really a gem....not to mention the excellent location (3 minutes walk to La Ramblas and P. de Gracia.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & city”
Reviews.Author: UtopiaUk
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel, staff are excellent, the location and facilities - especially the pool and spa are great. For a quieter room request a high floor and at the back of the hotel. Great breakfast. Really amazing city. Always be very vigilant in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “As Always Excellent”
Reviews.Author: laurad656
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Nov 2007 and returned again for my birthday last week. This is now my third stay here. Three of us in one room. I have not been the one to stay in the extra bed but my friend who did said it was very comfortable. Rooms at front of hotel overlook the main road and have lovely little balconys so I suggest if you don't want to be woken by the school as I have read in other reviews you ask for a room at the front of the hotel. The hotel staff are very accomodating and friendly. As it was my birthday whilst I was there, my mum contacted the hotel arranged for a bouquet of flowers to be delivered to me. The hotel arranged everything and got a beautiful bouquet from a florist on Las Ramblas, even packaging them up for me with so that I could take them home on the plane, rather than leave them behind. Couldn't have asked for anything more. Flowers were stunning and the housekeeper did an excellent job of sorting a pot/water etc for their journey home. Bottle water is provided free - they even sent a large bottle to our rom at 4am one morning on our return from our night out and did not charge which we were pleasently surprised about. I recommed you book the breakfast in advance for 8euros as this cannot be faulted. Will only ever stay here when visiting Barcelona and I recommend to many people. Excellent hotel, location great and the staff are very helpful - all for a price I feel is good value comared to other hotels in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible, but not good”
Reviews.Author: russc727
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in Barcelona, three at this hotel and three at another one nearby. The other hotel's listed price was higher, but the Apsis Atrium ended up being more expensive and it was a much less pleasant stay. First, I booked directly through the hotel's website and requested a room for three (my wife and I were travelling with an 18 year old daughter). We stopped by the hotel 2 nights before we checked in and found out we had a room for two booked, with no room for a cot. They moved us to a larger room at "no additional cost," but an additional 60 euro/night charge for the cot. Upon check in, everything seemed fine. The room was indeed adequate for the three of us. However, there is a school next to the hotel and we were awakened at 7am by hoards of youngsters playing in the schoolyard. It was impossible to sleep beyond 7am. That was ok with me, but not my 18 year old. Also, the walls do not appear to be any impediment to noise. I'm used to hearing my neighbors if they are talking as they leave the room next door. In this hotel I could clearly hear people talking from several rooms away, even from other floor levels. I travel a lot and have never stayed in a hotel with such poor acoustics. The flooring in our room was very cheap linoleum that was warping up in several areas. On the positive side, the location is excellent. Easy access to shopping and reasonable walking distance to several tourist sites. Two blocks to a metro stop. Four blocks to the airport bus at Plaza Catalunya (3 euro into the city, 4 euro back to the airport).. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean. The bathrooms were very nice. At checkout I was charged 25 euros for the few calls we made (I only used the phone three times to make dinner reservations, call a friend and once to check on the hours of Park Guell-probably 9 times total). At the other hotel we used there was no charge for local calls from the room. When it was all added up, I paid more per night for this hotel than the other, "more expensive" hotel. Our stay here was not a disaster, but I would not stay again and would definately not recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite”
Reviews.Author: FlyingDutchman82
Reviews.Content: The Apsis Atrium was a lucky pick as I stayed there during the yearly 3GSM Conference. I stayed in the suite on the topfloor of the hotel. Unfortunately on my own, really should be there on a romantic weekend with my wife. What a great location, with a fantastic view over the city. Stylish interior, great bed, luxurious bathroom with oval bubble bath, separate room with tv and couches, spacious bedroom with great beds and again a tv set. Sliding doors to the stretched balcony with wooden flooring and a Jacuzzi (which due to time of year was not working), deck chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler000
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful, cost was reasonable, very clean rooms and an excellent overall value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: juejosh
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit aprehensive and thought I maybe should have booked another hotel, but we had a great stay! We arrived at about 11:45am so expected to be asked to check in later, but no, the rooms were ready for us and reception was very helpful ensuring that our party was roomed close to each other. Our room was more spacious than the others as we had an accessable room, but all were clean with a lovely bathroom and a wide selection of 'bit and pieces' including toothbrush/paste and razors, which are useful with todays security restrictions, and these were replaced daily. The linen was crisp and clean and the rooms were well tended - they were also very warm - too warm for my husband but great for me! The breakfast offered a huge choice of continental items plus hot buffet and if ordered at the time of booking you get a 50% discount which makes in extremely reasonable for what is on offer - including cava/bucks fizz if you wish it - I didnt but kept thinking about it! The pool area is small, and because of the marble/wood mix can get slippy at times, but that where the complimentry slippers are useful. The pool itself - well, yes it is small, but is beautifully lit with changing lights for a relaxing feel. There is a seperate room with jaccuzzi in - big enough for 4 comfortably, 6 makes it 'intimate'. We were lucky that on our first visit both pool and jaccuzzi were empty, which meant our group had exclusive use, on our second visit only a couple and there baby were swimming so we jaccuzzied then swapped, as did they. There is also a sauna and a small gym. So plenty to occupy if it is busy. The location of the hotel is good, being near Gracia area and placa Catalunya and also the bus stops. The hotel is also good for business users with not only free wi-fi throughout but it has 2 computers on the 1st floor with free internet access too. All in all an excellent stay and when we return to Barcelona (hopefully in the Summer) we will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JACKKLAD
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 3 night break perfect location for this kind of thing and staff were really helpful with hotel and tourist matters. Stayed on the top floor (7) where i think the rooms are much bigger and better and a big balcony to match if you stay in the rear of the hotel (request this when booking if you can) All the usuals you would expect in the rooms and a bit more,tv,mini bar,bath robes,safe.....etc. Had breakfast just the last morning,a buffet breakfast with plenty of it and all you could want,bit expensive but worth it i suppose Brilliant pool,sauna,jacuzzi in the basement and suprised more people havent commented on it,the pictures on the website dont make it look as attractive as what it is......sitting in the jacuzzi after a hard days walking sight seeing......perfect!!,you can even hear the underground trains go by aswell!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: SophieStockholm
Reviews.Content: Booked a double w breakfast at this hotel on the hotel web-page. In the morning the evening after arriving, went to hotel-restaurant where breakfast was served between 7.15-10.30. We arrived in the restaurant at 10.15.The waiter greeted us by looking irritated and looking at his watch. He then informed us after asking for our room-number that breakfast was not included in our rate. When we disagreed, the waiter very briskly told us we had to step up to the front desk to sort things out, with about 10 minutes left of breafkast. He followed us there and consulted another staff-member, who searched for a transcript of our Internet-reservation, without finding it. A third employee in a more senior position was then involved in the "case", and quickly found our transcript only to see that breakfast indeed was included. We then went back to the restaurant in order to have breakfastand given there were now only a few minutes left of it, since the time now was betwen 10.20 and 10.25, sat down right next to the buffet. A waiter, not the same as before, then came rushing up to our table and declared that we were not allowed to sit there. He pointed at the far end end of the restaurant, which incidentally was as far away as possible from the buffet. We then felt we had had enough and decided to go to our room and order breakfast . This was probably just before 10.30. What was sent to our room was two small pieces of bread- rolls and one cup of coffe and one cup of tea, butter and marmalade and some dry croissants, far in quality from the buffet served at the restaurant.The two glasses of orange juice on our tray seemed to have been diluted beyond recognition. We then called and asked for some more bread-rolls, some more orange juice for both of us, coffee and tea. We received a new tray with one glass of orange-juice and one coffee. I then called again to ask about the bread-rolls and the tea only to be told that the hotel now had to charge extra for this since it was now after 10.30. I tried to explain the situation, but the woman at the reception was very firm and refused to send us anything free of charge. When we booked the room the information on the hotel web-page stated that either breakfast.buffet or breakfast in the room was included. The breakfast served in your room would be a continental one, but I thought that even as a such the breakfast we got up to our room was a very poor one.The hotel then charged extra for the coffee and the one glass of juice(as promised) when we checked out. Other "amenities" at the hotel included a business corner with two computers, but it seemed they had never heard of the fact that mouses need to get cleaned every once in a while in order to work, because one mouse was so full of dirt that it was useless to click with. We stayed in two different rooms, and they both had such thin walls that we could hear our neighbour going to the bathroom, or throwing up, which we had the "pleasure"of doing during one night. When somebody flushed it sounded like the ceiling was coming down. The drains in the shower and the sink did not work very good,so after taking a shower the tub was flooded with dirty drainage-water.The water-pressure in the shower was very weak for a four-star hotel. I also found old dental floss on the floor in the bath-room. Our room was extremely hot, and when I called reception about it I was told that they did not have the air-condition on,only heating in the winter. I felt to fed up to then ask why there in that case was a thermostat in the room, and if I lowered it, should not the room then get cooler(I tried that but it did not work,I lovered it to only 10 degrees centigrade, but the room was still as hot as before). We did get to switch rooms because of the heating, and were then asked to bring our bath-robes along to the new room, and also at first to come down to the reception to get the new key, but instants later the reception called us again and told us that they were of course giong to send a porter up with the key and also to help us with the luggage. The hotel also uses a system, where you get four small bottles of water for free, and this is all you will find in the mini-bar when arriving. Everything else that you might want i.e juice,beer,wine,soda you have to order up to you room and pay for , not only pay for what you drink from the mini-bar. We decided we wanted to settle the bill the evening before leaving, since we were leaving early in the morning. When my fiance went down to pay the bill, the receptionist refused to assist him, stating that he could indeed do that in the morning instead. My fiance then really had to argue to get to settle the bill the night before leaving, saying that we wanted to pay now because we were leaving early and wanted to minimize the strees of this. So then after much discussion he did get to pay. The next morning, we went up to the reception to leave our keys and the words of farewell from the receptionist was not"bye,hope you have enjoyed you stay" or something of the like, but"DID YOU PAY???".

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory But Not Worth The Rate...”
Reviews.Author: SilverRRCloud
Reviews.Content: We were quickly offered #602, spacious, comfortable with a decent view and low noise. Pros: Good location Professional and efficient staff Nicely sized room(s). Included WIFI Iron and board in the room Safe vault in the room Smart welcome kit Free bottled water Cons: Relatively very expensive €200.00 p. night Adequate but very basic breakfast Lack of maintenance: broken fixtures in the bathroom Lack of heating in mid-November!!! (The Front Desk said, they did not turn the heating on???) --- Would neither recommend nor book again myself. Far too expensive for the very mediocre service offered. SC

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Treabhar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights last weekend. Rooms are spotless and spacious with fairly large batchrooms with bath, sink and shower. Water both still and sparkling is free in the minbar. We stayed on the 6th floor where we heard very little noise. There is also a safe in the room. On the basement floor there is a spa, jacuzzi, small gym and small pool. Availed of the pool and jacuzzi which was great after a day of sightseeing and shopping. Hotel staff were helpful and had good English. It had a small bar which we used only a couple of times - the drink is actually quite cheap there. Did not eat anything at the hotel over the weekend, there are plenty of cafes, restaurants and coffee shops around for something to eat. The hotel itself is only a 5 minute walk to placa catalyuna and the top of La Rambla, which is ideal. From the Placa Catalyuna you can get the tourist buses around the city. There are separate routes, blue green and red. Make sure when you are queing that you are gettting the route that you want from the map. These buses go continually so you can get off at your pleasure. Overall a great weekend in a great city. Would go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Check your valuables!”
Reviews.Author: DaveReading
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel in a good location, Stay spoiled by the theft of my wife's handbag which the management refused to take seriously. No compensation offered. Special trip for a birthday treat and the duty manager even failed to tell me that he could not get a reservation for our chosen location until 1 hour before we were leaving for the meal. Did not take breakfast there as there many better and less expensive cafes nearby. Hotel rooms were clean and showers were a delight after a long day walking the streets. Very useful and large book on Barcelona which we used to select restuarants. Interference on BBC World channel so don't expect to stay in touch with sport/news while there. Bar staff good fun and huge digestivo drinks for 5 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, great value for your $$$”
Reviews.Author: traveller0808
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the hotel for 7 nights and I want to share my experience with you: Pros: -Convenient location – 25-35 minutes from the Airport (cost about 35-40 Euros), 2 minutes walk to the Passeig de Garcia and the Placa Catalunya Metro Station, 5-10 minute walk to Casa Batllo and 10-15 minute walk to Casa Mila, walking distance to the Gothic Quarter, Las Ramblas, Waterfront, Zara is just around the corner, and walking distance to the numerous great shops on Passeig de Gracia (Gucci, Zegna, Montblanc, LV, Bally, Cartier, Burberry, etc.) and the department store (El Cortes Ingles) in Placa Catalunya -The hotel is on a side street on Passeig de Gracia so it’s pretty quiet at night -Extremely friendly, courteous, and professional English speaking Front desk staff -Upon arrival, they give you maps (with key attractions circled), a card with the hotel address, phone number, and map on it so that you can simply show it to the taxi driver if needed, a tip sheet telling you to be cautious in certain areas at night and give you tips to avoid pickpockets. They offer to take a copy of your passport and stamp it with the hotel stamp. A lot of useful information on that tip sheet. Nice touch!!! -Simple and chic room décor -Safety deposit box and iron -You can set up morning call, view messages, and check bills on your TV -Nice hotel bar and restaurant (reasonably priced Dinner) -24 hour business centre with 2 computers -Free in room wireless Internet -Free water (2 sparkling and 1 regular bottle of water – restock every night) -Nice pool sauna, and Jacuzzi -A board range of bathroom amenities (razor, tooth brush, toothpaste, comb, shampoo, shower gel, soap, travel size packed tissue, shower cap, shoe shine, bathrobes, slippers, make up mirror, hair drier, sewing kit, etc.) Cons: -Late check-in time (my room is not ready until 3:45 p.m.) but you can safely store your luggage with them and visit the Gaudi houses on Passeig de Gracia -I got a room without a view (but who cares, I didn’t go the BCN to stay in the hotel room) -Small fitness centre (only 3 equipments) -No lockers or change room in the Spa/Jacuzzi/Fitness centre. So if I want to work out then swim, I have to go back to the room and change. Although I have to say it’s pretty safe leaving your clothes/sneakers/other belongings on the sofa while showering/changing (in the bathroom) -The lifts are a bit small and slow, but it’s not unusual in Europe for a hotel in an old building -They forgot to restock my mini bar the first night -Only 2 English channels (CNN and Eurosport) -Water pressure a little on the low side -Breakfast too expensive (if you don’t book in advance on their website) -No emergency exit information posted on the back of door -No environmental policy to advise guest to re-use towels (nowadays a lot of hotel post a notice in the bathroom to encourage guests to re-use towels)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: The4wardz
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a good location, not far from the Ramblas, in a slightly quiter area. I agree that the plumbing is rather noisy, but this did not bother us too much. Probably better on the higher floors, we were on the first fllor. The staff were very helpful apart from the mess up with the taxis. We wanted one 6 seater and we got 2 four seaters so we had to pay twice for the journey back to the airport. We should have used the bus as we did when we arrived. Ask for a room at the front. The views are nicer and all the windows are double glazed so no road noise. The rooms are also airconditioned.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Wood76
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel, with very friendly and knowledgeable staff. It's in a wonderful location, a safe location, surrounded by shops, bars and restaurants and away from the usual tourist areas. It is a 15 min walk to the marina, 20 min to the beach and is just round the corner from some of Gaudi's masterpieces. There is a metro station 2 mins away from the hotel which takes you to most locations. The hotel itself is very modern and clean. The rooms are a little small but certainly aren't lacking in any facilities and we didn't have a problem with noise. The breakfast is excellent and the bar is extremely cheap in comparison to La Ramblas. I would highly recommend this hotel and will be certainly making a return.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, location, staff”
Reviews.Author: Jannazg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay in Barcelona. It is close to the main streets, Las Ramblas and Passeig de la Gracia, minus the craziness that comes with staying on Las Ramblas. The staff is friendly and the breakfast an excellent value if you book ahead of time. The rooms are spacious, but without views. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: kaipbarrett
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for a short stay, room was a bit on the small side ( road side ) BUT you dont go to Barca to stay in the room.......The beds are very hard but thats what i like.Excellent location ( 2 blocks to Passeig de gracia and Las Ramblas ).........Air con was spot on, after spending all day walking in temps of 36 + it was a pleasure to walk into a cold room FREE bottled water and FREE in room safe

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BettyJScotland
Reviews.Content: Central location. Clean modern rooms with good bathrooms and balcony. Twin rooms not vast - but ok. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap finishing - poor insulation”
Reviews.Author: MarcLeuven_Belgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 27th December 2007 till 4th January 2008. We were given a spatious room at the front of the building overlooking the Gran Via. The rooms look great at first glance. At closer inspection you wil find that they are very cheaply finished. Sound insulation is below par especially between rooms. We were able to hear and understand the neighbours very clearly. The piping is done in such a bad way that every time a toilet is flushed or a bath tub emptied on one of the upper floors it generates an extremely loud roar which even wakes you up at night. The noise from the street side was acceptable. Our last night the poor plumbing finally gave way and the ceiling came down after the constantly battered piping had given way to yet another flushed toiled and emptied bath tub. We were appropriately moved to another room without further discussion. All in all : cheaply finished hotel, bad insulation, noisy, good location, over-priced. Maybe rather 3 than 4 star. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: TetonCLT
Reviews.Content: Nice room decor, clean, OK except for the noise!!! Our room # 307 was in the back area and just above an enclosed SCHOOL PLAYGROUND, which gave us no hope to sleep late. Additionally, this room had bizarre plumbing - every time the upstairs guest flushed or turned on the water, it would drian down through our pipes and toilet making very loud water running noises at any hour! The flooring also let us be aware of every step upstairs or in the hallway. Also the Housekeeping closet was next to the room, adding to the symphony of noise. When I asked to change rooms, I was informed there were none available.... This was by far the noisest hotel I have ever expereienced. The desk staff was polite upon arrival, those that knew English, but the wait staff in the bar and restaurant were chilly and very indifferent. Barcelona is a lovely city and we will choose to stay eleswhere on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: klean
Reviews.Content: One of the most excellent hotels I have ever stayed. Spacious room, very well equipped, polite staff, nice bar, close to Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “More Hard Beds”
Reviews.Author: grant_lina
Reviews.Content: After a long haul, we we're dying to get some rest late in the afternoon. Unfortunately our bed, as stated in previous postings, was "rock hard". We eventually asked for extra blankets and placed them between the matress and the sheet. This seemed to work OK. The next challenge was the noise emanating from the evening soccer/basketball games in the school grounds behind the hotel. As the hotel was fully booked, we couldn't change rooms. That said, the hotel is in a great location, the staff courteous and the other amenities such as the basement pool and spa were great after a day exploring this wonderful city. In my humble opinion, this hotel has the potential to be much better. Replace the matresses, install some double glazing and I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireMinsterman
Reviews.Content: Excellent all round hotel. Location 10 mins walk from Place Catalunya/Las Ramblas. 25 mins by Taxi (about €27 for 4 people +luggage) from the airport. 10 mins walk from Casa Mila, 5 mins from nearest Metro station which takes you everywhere! Well presented hotel, nice (if small) leisure facilties, but to find anywhere so central with a pool/sauna and jacuzzi is a bonus. Perfect after a hard days treck round the sights. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast very reasonable if you book in advance (€8 per person per day) which we thought was good value and served up until 10.30am for us lazy types! Must also mention restaurant Le Quinze Nits in Place Reial. Very reasonable prices and very good food - worth the queue as it doesn;t open until 8.30 pm on an evening - worth getting there at 8.00pm ish and queuing.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, price good”
Reviews.Author: mrspaper
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Atrium Palace for 2 nights prior to a cruise. It was easy to get to from the airport bus. We decided to take a chance on the bus, since no passengers get on after it leaves the airport and you get off at the last stop. it is a 3 block uphill walk to the hotel from the bus, but not bad at all. It was worth the walk. The staff were very nice and gave us a bottle of champagne for our anniversary. We used the pool and jacuzzi and they were just what we needed while awaiting our room to get ready. the staff brought us down shampoo, etc. breakfast was adequate. Coffee was terrible. make sure you find the business center with the free internet, although one of the 2 computers did not work while we were there. The location of the hotel was great. good walking location to picasso museum, shopping, Las Ramblas, and food. Many ATM;s all over. We ate at a popular Tapas Bar on the same street as the hotel, just 3 blocks toward Las Ramblas. It was good, although not cheap by the time you finish ordering all your mini plates of food. We found this Tapas bar on the internet, highly recommended, and when we asked the hotel staff where to go, they recommended the same place. The beds were not extremely comfortable, but adequate. the room safe was a nice size. we had a view of the courtyard and the kids playing outside from the school, but they did not awaken us. the bathrooms are adorned with all the amenities you need, and got replaced even if they didn't need replacement. "We did not even need to unpack our toothbrush, etc for the 2 days. We used the tourist bus to jump on and off, which worked out well. (other times we walked) It was fun to be a tourist. while they take you around, you can listen to headphones as they speak about what you see. We went to the aquarium as one of our destinations, and it was a nice one. Of course, don't miss all of Gaudi's buildings and parks. We could have used one more day to get in Montserrat. If you book on the hotel's website, they give you breakfast for 1/2 price, although you could probably do better eating a small breakfast on the street. I have no pics to add to the candid photos that haven't already been shown

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad beds”
Reviews.Author: limxela
Reviews.Content: Location: Great location in the center of the city, one block from Passaig de la Gracia. Staff: Friendly staff, pleased to serve you. Shaving kits, extra towels, anything else you need will be in your room immediately. Very clean and thorough room cleaning. Breakfast: Very decent breakfast with great expresso. Great service. Beds: Terrible beds - most (if not all) rooms have two double beds that slide apart on hardwood floor. To be close to my wife, I had to tie the beds together with towels. Very hard mattr essess. Only sheets for cover - no blankets. Pillows synthetic and hard.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed !”
Reviews.Author: Gordy2
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. We stayed for a night pre-cruise, and arrived about midday. Our room was ready and we were allowed into it right away. We managed to get a deal through Expedia which included buffet breakfast. Only disappointment was they served diluted orange juice and not the real stuff at breakfast. A Hotel of this class should be able to do better. The room was excellent, situated at the side of the hotel (No view whatsoever), but was very clean, modern, and quiet. The staff were excellent and very friendly. No qualms about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: GeoffL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Atrium Palace for four nights in early May. As written, the location is indeed excellent for shopping, dining, acess to tours and walking to the Gothic quarter. When taking a cab back to the hotel, use the nearest intersection(Grand Via & passeg de Gracia), as some do not know of the hotel as it is small. Rooms ver clean and well appointed. Air conditioning works quite well. We did not try the restaurant, but the bar service was excellent. We were on the front, with the door closed, most street noise was eliminated. Staff very accomodating. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Super hotel. Enjoy.”
Reviews.Author: incaman
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel offering real value for money. The location is perfect - probably the best in Barcelona. Everything is within walking distance. The staff are very friendly and accomodating. There is a lovely pool and Spa area. Yes it is small but it always seems to be empty. The pool was lovely and warm and perfect for relaxing after a hard days sightseeing. My only criticism would be that the restaurant area is unimpressive to look at although I didnt use the facility so I cant comment on the quality of the food or service. Rooms wre very nice, clean, cable TV and quite large. They can be a bit noisey with a school playground right behind the hotel. Overall, this hotel is a gem and I would definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel from which to go sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Adelmo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day break in Barcelona, staying at the modern Apsis Atrium Palace Hotel on the Gran Via. We could not fault the Hotel for location, cleanliness, friendly staff and good amenities. It was in an ideal place to either walk to the many tourists sights or catch the blue/red tourist buses that provide an armchair view of the city's attractions. We felt a 2 day bus pass for 23 euros was excellent value and a must if you wanted to see everything. Barcelona is such a vibrant and welcoming city and in our opinion much better than Madrid. There is so much to see and do that when we visit again we shall certainly be staying for much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: topgeeza
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of March and used the recommendations on this site as the basis for our choice. The hotel impresses immediately when walking into the grand lobby with it's sweeping stone staircase. The rooms are spacious in their tasteful contemporary design. Double beds are only available in the rooms at the rear of the hotel which overlooks an inner square of school playgrounds. If you like sleeping later than 8.30 in the morning, go for one of the twin bedded rooms at the front of the hotel, over looking Gran Via Les Corts Catalanes as a few hundred children playing can be noisy! ;-). I'd totally recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a quality hotel close to the city centre, near Metro lines and the attractions of Plaça de Catalunya, La Rambla and the Barri Gòtic district.

Reviews.Title: “Good Vaule for Money..Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LondonDoodle
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the fifth floor at the front of the hotel (we requested a room at the front after having read some previous reviews). It worked out around £50 a night per person for that we got a very large twin room with a nice bathroom (bathrobes, slippers etc) and an additional sink area in the bedroom which was handy for friends sharing. Would definately go back to this hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful and the location of the hotel is a real bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Handy if you want peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Roykeaneisgod
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice,clean and generally quiet. It is 5 mins walk from central square. Ensure you get a room that is not attached to the atrium or you will hear reception noise ( during day only). Lovely pub "Bobby's Bar" which is just around the corner and handy for the the last few after the main strip. We had one issue with a non flushing toilet but this was fixed immediately. Would rate higher but because of the atrium noise and the specific toilet have put at average.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: kittiebiddy
Reviews.Content: We got the bus from the airport to the plaza, only a 5 minute walk to the hotel, come off the bus,head for pas de gracia and turn right when you come to the water fountian, quite easy to find, the airport buses come every few minutes also and only cost 3.90. As you come out of the airport terminal the bus stop is 20 metres to your left. The hotel is in a great location for everything you want, very clean also and friendly staff, only complaints would be our view which was 4 plant pots and a wall, also you do hear everything from adjoining guestrooms, as we were hardly in our room it was'nt a major issue for us. There has been many complaints re beggars and thieves in barcelona, well we had no problems on that score, I've never seen so many police officers in a major city than I did in barca,even seen one hiding behind a tree ready to pounce on a unoffical street trader, (the tourists taking pictures of him gave the game away and the trader bolted). We only seen 2 beggars in the 3 days we were there. Disappointed with la rambla though, too many waiters pestering you for business, none of that on the pas de gracia which is 1 minute from the hotel. Though do watch out for the old man who likes to walk up that street wearing nothing but body paint and a pair of trainers...........sadly I saw him twice!!!!!! One last thing, we went in the middle of march and the weather was great, 20 degrees, great for strolling about town.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TravelWen
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Barcelona on the 10th of March. Followed by the enthusiastic reviews of the tripadvisors we have booked a twin room for 3 nights by Apsis Atrium Palace. This is our second visit to Barcelona. Last time we stayed in the Gallery hotel and we intended to stay at the same hotel again. Since the room price of Gallery hotel is quite high at this moment, we were very happy to book the room at Apsis Atrium Palace. For the general “Traveler rating” I was doubting between 3 and 4. On one hand, I think in Spain general this is an average 4 star hotel, but on the other hand, this is a hotel in Barcelona, consider the excellent location, the very reasonable room price and the helpful personnel, I think Apsis Atrium Palace definitely deserves to have a rating of 4 (above average). Our preference was a twin room, for some misunderstanding firstly we were offered a room on the first floor which was a room with a double bed plus a single bed and had no view at all. Fortunately we could change to a room on the 5th floor. It was very well maintained and perfectly clean. It is very comfortable to have slippers and bathrobes in room. The bathroom amenities are indeed quite extensive. Only we didn’t see the body milk as mentioned in the website. If I knew, I would bring my own. The air conditioning was working very well. The first two nights were nice and quiet. The third night (Friday night) was noisier. But this happens frequently in Spanish hotels. The sound insulation is often an issue. Since last year we always bring the silicone ear plugs with us when traveling, which works perfect. As every traveler agreed, the location of Apsis Atrium Palace is just perfect. Most attractions are in walking distance and all the public transportation stops close by. We bought two T-10 cards which give us 20 times travel within 1 zone by all kind of public transportation (bus, metro etc.) which was very convenient. For example, bus 50 stops almost in front of the hotel and goes to La Sagrada Familia, Plaza d’Espanya and Poble Espanyol. Overall, we had a pleasant stay in Apsis Atrium Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: love_2_travel666
Reviews.Content: Went to Barcelona for first time for a few days early March. Found the hotel from searching on google for hotels in City Centre locations. This Hotel says it is a 4* and I believe it is. Exterior is traditional but they have ripped out the interior and made it into a boutique hotel, with lots of wooden floors and panels. The main stairs in reception are still authentic. The reception staff were very helpful and advice on where to eat and what to do was very welcome. The hotel had a special offer if booking for 3 days or more you could have a buffet breakfast for 1/2 price, which for us was €8 per person per day instead of €16. Well worth it, self service for everything from Tea/Coffee to full cooked breakfast. Plenty of choice of fresh fruits and the usual pastries etc. Our room was a good size. We were at the back of the hotel in a double bed, with a sitting/changing area. We overlooked the school which could be noisy at break times and early evening when playing football or basketball tournaments, however we went to Barcelona for the sights not just the hotel. The only draw back, there was no tea/coffee facilities in the room. Mini bar had a good choice at a reasonable cost, however still and sparkling water were free and replaced daily. Safe deposit box in room was also free. Bathroom suited us fine, with good size bathrobes and slippers, and everything you would need for a short break in the way of toiletries, including toothbrushes, and wet shave equipment. We used the hotel pool and jacuzzi everyday, although one day the jacuzzi was out of order as 'someone' had put in some soap!! You need to know in advance if you want to use the sauna so the reception staff can ensure it is hot enough. The hotel recommend on their website to use the aerobus from the airport. €3.90 which was a good choice, it picked up outside the arrivals hall, last stop out of 3 was at Paca Catalunya, 2 blocks from the hotel, the map the hotel provide was very accurate. Barcelona is definitely on our list to re-visit and I will be booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “room with no view”
Reviews.Author: picky1
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews were generally accurate but I must say...... We stayed here for 4 nights from 28/2/2007 and have just returned home tonight. The rooms were clean and there was some decent bedding although the quilt smelt of aftershave which I found a bit too close to the previous occupant. We were given a room on the first floor. This may have been a family room as it had a bed settee. I was disappointed that we had a 'view 'of an air duct / conditioning pipe and a wall close opposite. Why do I always seem to get this so predictable? The hotel was very quiet and I cant believe there was nothing with a better view!! The pool is a very small plastic form type which for the hotel was disappointing as if you were going to build a pool you would build somthing better in your back garden. They missed an opportunity when building the hotel to do something much much better. The pictures on the net appear quite grand but it was not. The pool did have some atmospheric lighting and would change colour when this was switched on around day 3 but felt full with 5 adults and in the summer this would be an issue. When we first arrived the jaccuci was out of service which was disappointing but came into service after a day or so. The sauna was readily switched on when we asked for it to be but the sauna bucket was completely useless with holes in it and water literally flowed through the gaps and I got the floor swamped trying to introduce some water / steam. Breakfasts were okay with lots of fresh fruit. The kitchen appeared very clean and appeared to be subject to regular inspection by the management on a daily basis. The staff were nice and friendly. I would stay here again but if I had the choice would choose a hotel with a better pool and a room with a view. I have to say the biggest down side for me is the fact that the soundinsulation in the rooms was an issue. When someone flushed their toilet it sounded like the contents were rushing down the downpipe which sounded like it was in the wall near my bed. This was very very off putting. Also there was from time to time no doubt about the fact that someone was using their bathroom. I dont know if this had something to do with the fact that our room on the first floor was at the bottom of the hotel ( no pun intended) but avoid first floor if you find this off putting. You can hear the school kids which was not a problem but shame about the lack of a view of any kind. If you have kids try The Mafia restaurant on the walking route to the Ramblas. Nice and child friendly. Also Port Olympic was the best beach we found and there are nice restaurants. Take the tourist bus if you want to avoid a long walk. Everyone warns you about pick pockets in Barcelona. I have never seen so many people on the street ( i live in London) and there are many police about so you should be okay but dont put your bag down or I suspect you will lose it!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tonybyrne81
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently returned from a 3 night stay at the Atrium Palace and overall we enjoyed a pleasant say. The room was nice, quite spacious and clean. Bathrobes and slippers were supplied along with mini bar, extra pillows, iron and ironing board and in room safe. The TV had limited channels 3 of which were English language (BBC World, CNN & Eurosport). The mini bar was well stocked and included 2 free bottles of still and 2 free bottles of sparkling water in the room every day. We did have a few problems getting the in room safe to lock but the staff were very helpful with this and attended to it quickly. The bathroom was again spacious and clean lots of toiletries were supplied although the shampoo wasn’t great. The hotel pool was clean but quite small. Reception staff were great; they were very helpful and dealt with any questions to the best of their ability. The Hotel is in a great location - 5 mins walk to the top of La Rambla. A few things to note: There are a number of schools located directly behind the hotel. Kids start playing there at about eight in the morning and they create quite a bit on noise. So if you aren’t an early riser ask for a room at the front of the hotel. Cleaning staff start around the same time and again they create quite a bit of noise especially if your room is located beside a store room as ours was. I noticed a few comments on trip advisor about empty cans of coke etc. in the mini bar and we had the same experience. Also the mini bar is quite expensive (3.50euro for a can of coke). Overall though our stay was enjoyable and we would recommend the Atrium Palace to friends travelling to Barcelona in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: cgmail
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Atrium Palace for 3 nights in Feb 2007 and have to say it is a little gem in the centre of Barcelona. We took the train when we arrived at the airport - EUR2.50 per person one way and the train stops at the Passeig de Gracia metro station about 200 metres from the hotel. Check in was smooth and we were able to check in at 1pm when we arrived. In the room, there were lots of handy toiletries - toothbrush, razor, shampoo, shower gel, tissues, lavender hand wipes. We also got bathrobes and slippers in our hotel which you're instructed to wear down to the spa - spa is lovely, small pool, jacuzzi (which was not very hot!) and a sauna which was lovely. Towels were provided in the spa so no need to take any down with you. The rooms were great, extra pillows provided, in room safe, ironing board, limited tv channels but we didnt really watch it too much. Also view from our room was of the basement but we didnt mind, as we didnt spend all that much time in the room. A nice touch was the 2 free bottles of still and 2 free bottles of sparkling water in the room every day. Reception staff were great - we had forgotten to take a charger with us and they let us borrow one for our stay and also on one of our days there, it rained and they loaned us a large umbrella to take out with us for the day. It's so central though - on the Gran Via des Cort Catalanes, 5 mins brisk walk to Plaza Catalunya and a few mins further takes you to the top of Las ramblas. I will definitely be back to the Atrium Palace.

Reviews.Title: “excellent but may have been a temporarily low price”
Reviews.Author: learnerplates
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel,could not fault it, service was fantastic, very clean, bright and new, trendy too Location about 20mins walk from la ramblas. .but the price may have been an introductory, it may have increased since 3 yrs ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: bkchill
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during a weekend. The hotel is nicely located very close to the metro and trainstation of the airport train and the city center. The room was very clean, spacious and although facing the street quiet. You get everything in the room you need, even slippers! The spa has a jaccuzi, a sauna and a pool you are happy to use after a long day of walking around. The breakfast was amazing: champaign, salmon, ham, fruits, eggs, just everything you wish. I will definitely come back once more to this beautiful place. And not to forget, staff was very polite!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: rochelle.alexis
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. The minor 'faults' did not ruin our stay in any way at all and we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Barcelona. The rooms are a good size and comfortable. Minor 'issues' with the hotel would be the following... 1. our room (on the 3rd floor) overlooked a children's playground. It got loud around 8:30-9AM - depending on what you did the night before, that could be early!! 2. noise in general. We could hear everything in the hallway. Because of the hardwood floors, sometimes we heard, for example, a chair being dragged across the floor from the room above us. 3. Bathroom ammenities... The shampoo and body wash (I thought) were not up to a 4 star standard. Of course they did the trick, but they were not luxurious by any means. Also, there was no lotion! 4. the Whirlpool in the spa was broken while we were there. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel - it seemed a little pricey to us at 16 Euro per person. There are plenty of places to eat around the corner for much cheaper. None of those things disrupted our stay in any way. The location of the hotel makes getting anywhere in Barcelona extremely easy. The directions to the hotel from their website are perfect. The hotel staff was great. They made wonderful food recommendations and were helpful in other ways as well. As mentioned aboved, the room was a good size and comfortable. There was even an extra sink in the room which was convenient for getting ready! I would recommend this hotel to my best friend and my parents, it was the great!

Reviews.Title: “best value for money”
Reviews.Author: bruno.bemelmans
Reviews.Content: (Sorry for my English) We have been here two times and we find this the best value for the price you pay (130 euro in the centre of town, four stars)) - The staff is very friendly and polite - The room we stayed is was big enough for us, two adults and one child (10 years old) - Airco is ok. - Indeed not so many channels on the TV but that is not why you come to Barca. - Last years I booked two splendid communicating rooms for the two of us and our three daugthers. - The pool is indeed small but the water is lovely, the sauna perefct and the jacuzzi worked all the time. There is a change in color in the pool every minute. - The rooms are superbe clean and the girls who cleaned it were very friendly. - The breakfast is great with everything you need (even red wine and 'cava' if you want) - The nearest metro is a 200m walk - The Plaza Catalunya is about 400m. - Taxi from airport to hotel: 20 euro - Very impressive 'buffet' between 13 and 16h: 20 euro - Just one thing to complain: we heard the toilet flush of another room... We will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ab0si
Reviews.Content: The Atrium Palace is a rather new hotel four blocks from Placa de Catalunya. Easy transportation between the airport and that plaza is avalable by rail and bus (I sugest the bus, it is usually faster, more comfortable and you are less likely to have to fight off pickpockets). Taxi will be about 30 euro from the airport (a bit more on Sundays and in the evening). This is an excellent location with easy access to the metro, buses, the tourists "circle" buses. Of course, you can walk to many of Barcelona highlights eaisly from the hotel. Is the location "ok?" Well, the Ritz is 100 meters to the east. The reception staff was great. They kept trying to help me and seemed disappointed that I didn't need any special help. The room I was given is simply huge by European standards. Simple, modern decor and that great European rarity: reading lights over the bed bright enough to actually allow one to read in bed. Bedding was two full beds placed together. VERY hard beds (I consider this a good thing; you may not). The bathroom was fully equipped with tub/shower, vanity. toilet and bidet. A full range of "stuff" was provided (disposable razor, toothbrush, sewing kit, bathrobes, slippers, etc. et al. Big fluffy towels, lots of hot water and excellent water pressure. Breakfast was served (7:15 to 10:30) is served in the hotel's small bar/restaurant buffet style. A full range of fruit, breads, cereal, cheeses, meats, yogart and eggs are provided. The orange juice is not fresh squeezed. Free computer/internet available 24-hours/day in the business center as well as free wifi throughtout the hotel. There seems to be internet available through the TV and there was an RJ45 hook-up in the room. I didn't try either of these, but simply used WIfI. Small swimming pool, sauna, hot tub and a basic exercise room is open until 11:00 pm. One hint: They take privacy seriously. When you leave the room for the day, hang the "Make up the room" on the door. Summary: great room, excellent location, very helpful staff, good price. Hard to beat that.

Reviews.Title: “Apsis Atrium Palace Barcelona - SUB STANDARD - DO NOT BOOK!”
Reviews.Author: NorthernTraveller125
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the hotel today. 1. Pool is tiny and i mean tiny 2. Fitness suite - 3 machines 1 stepper and, and all in one and a cross trainer - poor quality. Water from air con leaking all over wood floor which makes it DANGEROUS 3. Rooms were not ready still at 4.30pm on day of arrival. 4. Half drunk can of coke in the fridge - shows they do not check the fridges in rooms very often. 5. Maids were hit and miss....some times they left towels, slippers etc other days they did not 6. The maids left their very dirty floor cloths on the desk 7. Jacuzzi Bath did not work for the whole of the stay - they new about it but failed to tell us - apparently it had been broken a while 8. Breakfast discounted if you book in advance - average breakfast. 9 We booked Restaurant for new years eve dinner in advance but when we sat down the Maitre D told us all that was not available - was easier to tell us what was available. In fact he directed us to a nice place around the corner. 10. The english TV channels had NO sound 11. Air conditioning is non existent - cooler to leave doors open and listen to traffic all night. 12. God forbid that you have any emergency issues as the whole hotel was run by receptionists / front office manager (Maria who was not there often either) - Mr Lara was on holiday in the south of spain and although they spoke with him he did not ask to speak to me to apologise of offer to help IMPORTANT Advice also: We booked 2 suites which were nice suites if tvs and jacuzzis worked (3000 euros) - our friends booked a private car through the hotel so that they could have a child seat for their new born baby - the car turned up without a car seat and charged them 85 euros for a 20 euro journey. No kettles in room if you need to boil water for babies We were offered 80 pound discount for all of the above problems - they ruined our holiday and offered us 80 pounds....! We were only offered an apology when we came to check out. This is a 1 star hotel that wants to be a 5 star hotel when it grows up - so far it is far from growing up and has to be the worst run hotel I have ever stayed in (And I have stayed in well over 100 different ones worldwide). Our friend (Who also stayed there) is a travel agent and is going to talk any prospective customers away from this hotel as this is the worst she has stayed in! My advice - DO NOT STAY THERE. Paul PS...I am still waiting for a response to my email.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ordtravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apsis in early October. We had a very enjoyable stay. Our room was clean and roomy for my husband and I. We were on the 3rd floor so we didn't hear much noise from the school behind the hotel. It would have been lovely to stay in one of the terrance rooms. Also, we did not take part in the daily breakfast since we are happy with toast and coffee in the morning. We walked to all the sights in Barcelona from this hotel, Sagrada Familia, the Port, Barcelona Cathedral, Art Museum, ect. But, remember, as "compact" as this city is, it is still a lot of walking so bring comfortable shoes! The hotel staff is great with recommendations for restaurants. We dined at Fernandez one night which was great. Also, there's a great restaurant called Ba-ba-Reeba for tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the place”
Reviews.Author: Lexusman
Reviews.Content: I went back again one month after my last stay and it was even better than the last time which surprised me . The receptionist who checked us in ( David } was just so professional and polite. I / we will definitely be back again

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: bcarter456
Reviews.Content: The Atrium Palace is a very nice hotel. It has a great location, has beautiful rooms, and a very helpful front desk staff.
