That being said, one has to be very careful in Barcelona, like a lot of European cities. Barcelona is a city of theives. Don't believe me? Walk the busy city streets and look at the women at the sidewalk cafes. Every single one has their purse on their lap, directly in front of them. The reason is simple. Purse snatching is rampant. Please protect yourself with a money belt and don't don't carry anything valuable in a purse. We didn't think it would happen to us. But my wife had her had firmly on her purse and it was snatched from her in front of a dozen people. To their credit, the local people were very sympathic and offered us tremendous compassion and help in our time of need. I don't mean to demean the city of Barcelona. It's a beautiful place and I would visit it again in a hot second. Back to the Atrium Palace. We went directly back to the hotel after the purse snatching an they were very helpful in getting our credit cards stopped and so on. But, the next morning, the mini-bar guy came into our room while we were sleeping and stole 100 euros from our room! I couldn't believe it. I went immediately to the front desk to report this, but it was his word against ours. First of all, I admit to being an idiot. One should never leave money out in plain view in a hotel room. My mistake, to trust the hotel staff. The lesson here is a) Barelona is beatufiul and a very worthy place to visit, and b) expect to be stolen from at the slightest opporunity.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bristolblonde
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic I booked the hotel as a surprise trip for my partner and we had a wonderful time. The location of the hotel is perfect and the hotel itself is great with the little extra touches which make the stay at the hotel lovely. Staff were fantastic and I would definately stay at this hotel again when returning to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Not great in Barcelona and Spain standard”
Reviews.Author: dimsum
Reviews.Content: If this hotel was in other cities, I might find it very impressive as it was housed in an old building. But after a journey of more than 14 days through out Spain, I found this hotel deserved the grade 'average' only. Location The location was good but not superb. It was relatively close to a metro but not very close. We still had to walk more than five minutes to the metro. Five minutes in Spain autum sun was already very long and even worse when we finished shopping. Room We booked a suite at this hotel as a treat as it was the final leg before our transit back to Madrid. It proved to be a waste of money. If you decided to stay at this hotel, my advice is go for the cheapest room category. Save your money for other purposes or stay at a better hotel. Service No warm welcome or sincere goodbye was offered. No smiling face at the reception. Don't expect five star or small family run hotel service. Facilities The internet service was alright. The indoor pool was the only merit of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good hotel, great location, wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: D&MGR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atrium Palace over Hallowe'en and really enjoyed our stay. On the whole a very good experience, a few small downsides: worth a score of 4½ but I'll plump for a 5 as we can't give half points. Positives - great staff , very friendly and helpful eg checked up bus routes and timetables for us. Check in was quick and room was clean and well appointed. Free water from the minibar a bonus. Air conditioning worked well if perhaps a little too enthusiastically at times. Previous reviewers have been mixed about the breakfast - we found it fine, good selection of fruits, breads, meats and cheeses along with cereal. There was a cooked breakfast but we didn't try it so can't comment. Not sure it is worth €16 though - we booked it though the website for half price and at €8 it was more than adequate. We were late back to the hotel one night after a trip down the coast and decided to eat in the hotel - we don't normally do this but I was surprised - good food and very reasonable (including the wine). Location is also quite good - on Barcelona’s main street (we had a room at the back so can’t say if rooms at the front are noisy), 5-10 mins from the Ramblas and convenient for metro/buses. Slight downsides - there was some noise from the schoolyard which others have mentioned (and not just in the morning, but used for 5-a-side football one evening). Wasn't too bad though. Swimming pool is rather small but still at least there is one. Rooms are good and a reasonable size for a city centre hotel - but some of the space was wasted (why two sinks - one in the room itself as well as one in the bathroom when the space could have been used for a second easychair?); and there is no lounge area to speak of in the hotel. But these are minor gripes. On the whole a very positive experience. Oh , and Barcelona is wonderful by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Nontall
Reviews.Content: Date: Oct 13, 2006 Reviewer: MSponder, Ft. Lauderdale, Florida My husband and I stayed at the Atrium Palace the night before and the night after our Mediterranean cruise. Hotel staff is wonderful- very accommodating, friendly and helpful in giving directions, recommending restaurants etc. The hotel is in an excellent location and the free internet service is a welcome bonus. While the rooms are clean (and come equipped with a safe) and the bathrooms are spotless, the beds are a little too hard for my liking. I probably would not choose this hotel if my stay were to extend beyond a couple of days because of this. Also make sure you ask for a non-smoking room if that is your preference as we had a smoking room our second night since we did not specify and the hotel was booked so we had no option to get another room. We had to blast the air conditioner and open the windows for a few hours to try to get rid of the smell. The elevators are teeny tiny (4 adults at a time) so if there is a crowd waiting, it could take a while to get to your room unless you choose the stairs. If I ever return to Barcelona I would probably try another hotel just to compare value. Not sure if it was worth US$220 per night but we still had a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Mojie
Reviews.Content: Had a great 3 day stay in Sept 2006. Hotel is small, quiet and modern. Location is convenient, near both Ramblas and Aixample areas, subway stops, and hop on and off tour buses. Staff was very friendly and offered good advise. Room size is fine (for Europe) and quite modern. Book breakfast, if possible -- the buffet spread (again, for Europe) is great!

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: katarob
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel in July 2006 for 2 nights. The rooms are much smaller that what they look like in the website. The bathroom is very modern and nice. The beds are HARD , but we slept ok as we were so tired both days. The staff at reception is very nice and location is good. However, don't know if I would stay there again. For a couple of nights it was OK, but for longer time, the rooms would feel too tight. The staff at the breakfast room is surly. I wouldn't recommend it. The 2nd day we went to a cafe around the corner and had great breakfast for half the price ( eventhough we had paid "only" 8 euros for breakfast at the hotel the 1st day).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helenlc0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atrium Place in May & had a fab time. Check in was speedy, room was fine - nice & clean. We had a standard double which was plenty big enough for us. The only gripe I had was the noise from the school (our room was at the back of the hotel). It wasn't a huge problem as we were out and about most of the time... (Just those early mornings!). The room was cleaned/tidied daily, with fresh towels left if you wanted them. The hotel staff were brilliant - couldn't do enough for us, especially reception. We arrived around 9.30pm (a little later than expected) so the lady on reception offered to book us a table at a nearby restaurant while we got changed etc - Superb. Facilities in the hotel were fine, everything we expected. The swimming pool is a little on the small side - but it was ok for us. The sauna was great especially after a hard day's sightseeing. We didn't actually eat in the hotel so can't really comment on the food side of things. All the public spaces/seating areas were were always clean never noticed anything out of place. Location is good - hotel is very central, close to all the shops. It's fairly easy to find from the airport - as we discovered... We decided to get on the bus (it's a lot cheaper than getting in taxi). Overall, a good quality hotel - would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Eyal
Reviews.Content: We reserved the hotel 4 months ago for our vacation in Barcelona (family of 2 adults one teen and one child, thus we needed two connected rooms) based on the great reviews we read in the Tripadvisor. We checked in around 12 and were asked to come back around 3 PM. Already when we entered the lobby we were getting the impression that something is not working as it should, the rug was stained, there were crumbs in the elevator and the impression was not very good. When we came back we were offered rooms 610 and 611 in the 6th floor, but when we entered the rooms a very strong smell of smoke hit us combined with dirt on the floor dust on the furniture and hair on the blankets, immediately we asked for cleaner and no smoking rooms, although the hotel was full the receptionist was very kind and moved us after an hour we had to wait to 2 not connected rooms in the 3rd floor (the rooms were much cleaner and smelled from massive use of air freshener so we assumed they re-cleaned them) apologizing and promising that on the following day we will have the non smoking connected rooms. This was sufficient and as promised we were moved on the next day to two connected rooms in the same (3rd) floor. Still I must also add that on the second day when we went to the SPA in the evening (very very small and cold) we noticed and killed cockroach in the swimming pool and I am sure you can still find it under the wooden floor near the oval window To summarize the four nights we stayed there I will say that - The staff is supporting the location is good and the deal for the breakfast is very nice. BUT we can not ignore the poor maintenance level (why they do not clean the elevators more often? Why there are all these black signs that the luggage left on all the walls inside and outside the rooms? Why they do not clean the mini-bars from leftovers of other guests and dirt?). The potential exist but the high expectations could not fulfill.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon bliss”
Reviews.Author: monkeymatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at his hotel on our honeymoon, based on cost and location and its 4 star rating - and on the whole, it was a good stay. The place was clean and well maintained, any faults that occurred (in our case the lifts and jacuzzi were, on separate occasions out of order) were swiftly rectified. The restaurant served a good breakfast, although I'm glad we booked for bed & breakfast, I feel the cost of 16Euros per day per person was a little excessive. We chose not to eat in the restaurant beyond breakfast, as it was a little too clinical, almost like a canteen, rather an atmospheric dining experience. The room we had was lovely, air conditioned, cleaned daily and stylishly decorated, containing a double bed (at my request) which was firm and comfortable. Our only minor niggles were, (i) the view from our room - they knew it was our honeymoon, yet we looked out on air conditioning ventilation ducts and the back end of another building, and (ii) they offered no exchange service - meaning one evening when I approached to cash some travellers cheques, they wouldn't, subsequently leaving us short of money for the evening. However, neither of these affected our overall enjoyment. I would recommend this place, for many reasons, maybe not quite value for money, but certainly for location, cleanliness and design.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: OBERMAN
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 6 nights at the Apsis Atrium Palace. Perfect Location, Perfect Hotel, beautifull rooms, we stayed at the front hotel rooms, no noise from the gran via street. Very good breakfast for the value- book in advance from the hotel website so it is only half price -8 euros. The staff is very nice and the free 4 bottles of water per day are a bonus very wellcome - barcelona is hot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller19617
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apsis Atrium Palace at the end of June 2006. The hotel is in prime location, ten minutes walk from the Ramblas, the same again from the Gothic quarter and 100 metres from the metro. The room was modern and functional with all that you would expect from a four star hotel. A nice touch was the free still and fizzy water from the minibar. We asked for a quiet room and were allocated a room that looked out on to a school playground. Despite contrary views in other reports there was little noticeable noise. The weather was very hot so we were pleased that the air conditioning worked well. I tried the sauna, spa and pool; all were excellent although the pool is more of a plunge pool than a swimming pool! The staff were friendly and very helpful. The only food we had in the hotel was breakfast which was excellent although we found it was better earlier rather than later. If you book directly with the hotel you can pre-book the breakfast half price (8 Euros) which we thought was good value. The only issue we had was that we found the lifts to be hot and steamy. We loved Barcelona and would recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Hotel and Staff, Disliked the Beds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 day prior to and 2 days after a cruise at this hotel. Had a room in back the first night and a room in front the next 2 nights. The Hotel is great, the staff was excellent and very helpful. The hotel is located within a few blocks of La Rambla. Just an execllent location for visiting Barcelona. The air conditioning worked too well at times. The room in back was on the 6th floor and we noticed no noise at all from the playground but we did keep the windows closed. The room in front was on the 5th floor and was again quiet due to keeping the windows closed. I enjoyed the free internet service. The only thing I did not like were the beds. They were like sleeping on a concrete floor with a thick piece of cardboard between you and the concrete. Word of warning to Barcelona visitors. It was told to me by the hotel and I did not listen closely enough. Watch out for the pick pockets in the subway. They ruined a great vacation for us by stealing my digital camera right off my belt. Lost 1/2 of my cruise pictures as well as the camera. The police told me they are after cameras and cell phones as well as wallets. So be very careful and hold onto everything in crowded areas.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very modern”
Reviews.Author: sammc
Reviews.Content: A large group of us stayed here to attend a family wedding and we found it to be of a very good standard. lacks a bit of personaility, but the location is great, especially for shoppers!!! The service was good, rooms small but spotless and very modern. It was a a bit annoying to be telephoned by reception at 12 on the dot on our final day to make sure we were getting out on time .... But overall, I would definitely return to this hotel for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Atrium Palace was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: FunandSun2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atrium Palace for 2 nights preceeding a cruise and really enjoyed the location and atmosphere of the hotel. The rooms were very clean and a little larger than average considering european standards. The bar was great for having a few drinks before heading out for an evening dinner. Would not recommend the breakfast though as 40 euro was steep for what you received. Our room was on the street side of the hotel and there were no noise problems at all. The view from the small balcony was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and modern. Great experience”
Reviews.Author: snshn3
Reviews.Content: My review comes in a little late, but I still would like to give in my input. We stayed at this hotel last June and had a great time. The hotel is in a great location, it is very modern and clean. The staff offers excellent service as well. The only thing is that we had a room overlooking a school yard. Luckily we weren't in our room much during the day when the kids were playing outside and became quite noisy. Aside from this, our experience was great. I **LOVED** the free internet they provide; it was nice to keep in touch with family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to this hotel - will definatly be making a third.....”
Reviews.Author: MaryMacBristol
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are repeat customers for this hotel as stayed here a couple of years ago too. Hotel Amenities - Minimalistic Comtemporary Cool. Very clean rooms equiped with sat TV, iron & board, air con, full length mirror, firm but comfy beds, spacious bathroom with power shower. Bathrobe & slippers provided too. Safe in room. Pool is very small however satisfies for a quick dip. Nice jacuzzi & sauna. Fitness room is pretty poorly equiped so better to go out for a run to the beach! We have stayed in rooms at both the back & front of the hotel & I have never found the noise an issue like previous reviewers have (& I generally need to sleep with earplugs as it has to be silent for me!). Naturally, there is some noise at the back of the hotel as there is a primary school playground out the back however the little'uns are only out there playing during the week after 9am anyway so don't see what the issue is with that!? Location - very central & ideally located for sightseeing & shopping - no need for taxis in evenings, etc as within walking distance to cool bars/restaurants. Located just off Passeig Gracia up from Placa Catalunya. Las Ramblas is a 10 min stroll down the road. Eating/Drinking - excellent Tapas Bar nearby is Txapela - this is located on Gracia. Always bustling full of locals. Good pizza @ Veronica's. Anima off C/Carme serves excellent med/asian fusion type food. There are also a number of funky bars around Carme as well as more restaurants. Best bar for Mojitos has to be all time favourite 'Boadas Cocktails' situated just on the corner of the first right hand turn off Las Ramblas- it is very smoky inside but worth it for the experience! Shopping - There's a massive Zara on the corner of Gracia/Cortes Catalanes. Most of the big name desingers can be found further up Gracia (Loewe, Gucci, Chanel, LV, Stella Macartney, etc) Would recommend exploring maze of streets to the left of the Ramblas around the Gothic quarter & near Cathedral as there are some funky little boutiques to be found. Didn't actually eat in hotel as don't see the point when there's so many places to eat out for breakfast, lunch & dinner.. Barcelona is a placed to be explored rather than sitting in your hotel! We did however have a few drinks at the bar after days shopping/before heading out & the service was always excellent & served with a genuine smile.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied... this hotel is a a very good value.”
Reviews.Author: Sarasota34235
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to be guests at the Atrium Palace May 7th through the 11th. Based on a previous review, we requested a "06" room on the front of the hotel and we were lucky enough to be in Room 606, a beautiful, large, twin-bedded room overlooking the Gran Via with glass doors that open to reveal the city. With the windows closed, the room was soundproof. Unlike previous reviewers, I never had any noise issues at this hotel. No noise from the beautiful wooden floors and no unwanted noise from the Gran Via. The room was extremely comfortable, well furnished and the air conditioning worked extremenly well. The bathroom was magnificent - modern with beuatiful finishes, Grohe fixtures, a bidet and a separate second sink area as a seaparate part of the main room. The staff was consistently accomodating. I have to offer extreme thanks to Maria at the front desk. She was always extremely helpful, had the information we needed, offered great recommendations of things to do and greeted us with a smile and hello or welcome back. She is very special. We did partake of the breakfast buffet (at the pre-booked 25% discount). It was 12 Euros after the discount. We found it terrific and the restaurant staff worked extremely hard to satisfy the many guests. In summary, I would not hesitate to recommend the Apssis Atrium Palace or stay there again. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but extremly noisy at back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am just back from spending 5 days at this hotel and have mixed feelings about it. When we arrived on the Monday, we got a room at the back of the hotel and was very impressed with it, clean, spacious but very hot. The thermostat was at 35! Turned this down and turned on what I thought was the air con but room didnt cool. Opened big windows and didnt think anything of it. NEver heard a whisper the entire day but from 7.30 am the next morning, there was a constant racket from the school at the back until 9.30 pm for the rest of the week. Complained to the desk about the air con not working and was told that it doesnt work in the winter! This was Feb/March and it was 17% C in Barca.. They said to open the windows and I explained that I couldnt because of the noise and was told they would look into it but never heard anything more.. Apart from that, the hotel was lovely, free juice/water and toiletries as advertised and was also given a free bottle of Cava as they found out it was my g/f birtday while we were there (which was a nice touch). Spa/pool very small, deceptivley so compared to pics on website. Perfect location though. Do not pay for breakfast as the hotel charges €16 pp..and you can get brekkie for nothing close by. Overall, would maybe stay here again but only for the location and only if I was promised a quiet room and one with working Air Con...

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: citygal8
Reviews.Content: We ( a family of 4) had a wonderful stay at the Apsis Atrium Palace(Barcelona, Spain) in Late Feb. We had 2 rooms on the front of the hotel overlooking the beautiful Boulevard. We booked our room through the hotel's own web site and got the best rates. We booked early and received a discount for staying over 3 nights. By booking thru the hotel yourself, there are no booking fees and you can cancel up to two days before with no penalty. Also, you don't pay anything until you check out. This 4 star hotel was no more expensive than many of the 3 stars I looked at. As per previous posts, the room is a little warm, but when we opened the Balcony doors, we cooled off the room and it was great. The staff was marvelous and attentive. They offered help with directions, luggage, etc. There are 2 (easy to use)computers with free internet access in the second floor business center. There was free water/juice in the mini bar as advertised. Also, there were lots of free toiletries in the room including a toothbrush/paste, razor, and all the usuals, etc. (nice touch) The hotel is clean. This hotel is very centrally located to all Barcelona attractions in a safe area. It's just two blocks to Placa Catalunya (transportation hub)and a few blocks to El Corte Ingles dept store.(has full supermarket in basement)There is also a citibank 2 blocks away.Las Ramblas was a 5 min walk. The hotel is near many of the Gaudi sites. We took the hop on/hop off bus which was a great way to get acclimated to Barcelona and hopped off at the sites that were harder to get to. We didn't have the hotel breakfast, it was pricey, but found lots of inexpensive cafes nearby to eat in. We found a superb restaurant that just opened next door to the hotel "Patagonia Beef and Wine" It's an argentinian steak house. The service was as great as the food and freshly made sangria. We ate there 2 out of our 5 nights. It was that good. All in all, Apsis Atrium Hotel is a centrally located, safe, clean hotel with lots of extras. I highly recommend it and will stay there again when I return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pwee
Reviews.Content: The Atrium Palace is located on the Grand via de les cort catalanes which is an excellent location for a short city break. You are no more than a few minutes walk to the Las Ramblas, the Passeig de Gracia and the Place de Cataluyna. The Hotel itself is very tidy, the standard rooms are very clean (no tea & coffee) and the staff very good. The Spa area is small. I'm not sure if I would class this hotel as a 4 star, however, it is worth it for the location alone.(Tip - the hotel backs onto a school, if you like to sleep in late, ask for a front facing room. It can get a little noisy with the young kids impersonating Ronaldinho)

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for thin walls”
Reviews.Author: petermay123
Reviews.Content: Have to agree with previous review about the noise from courtyard, room temperature and the thin walls (I must have stayed in a room close to this person on the same weekend as we experienced exactly the same "noises" coming from a nearby room). Location excellent, good quality rooms/services, very clean and staff extremely friendly. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mpar44
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, spotlessly clean and everything was as new. The free water from the room bar was a bonus as was the free use of the safe in your room. This hotel was great value for money for a 4 star hotel. I have only two complaints about my stay in the hotel, firstly i didnt recieve the free bottle of cava i requested when booking (no big deal as it only costs £2-£3 for a bottle) and the hotel was slightly too warm. overall it is a 1st class hotel in a good location and i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe811
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for many reasons. The staff is very friendly, it's in a great location only two blocks from the square, and the hotel is maintained very well. The only negative is if you need accomodations for a third person..... in the states it's called the couch. I'll definitely stay there again as long as my travel party is two people or less.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy weekend at the Apsis Atrium Palace”
Reviews.Author: Shamfeen
Reviews.Content: We spent a 3 night weekend in Barcelona staying at the Apsis Atrium Palace on the Gran Via. We have stayed at the Hilton, Grand Hyatts and Marriot hotels in San Francisco numerous times so we know a fine hotel when we see it. This hotel was very nicely finished, the staff very professional and helpful. The room was a good size with everything you would find in a large US hotel including free wireless internet access. The hotel also has a small swimming pool, hot tub, sauna and gym. The location is excellent - we walked pretty much everywhere from the hotel: the hi-end retail stores are nearest, gaudi's house of bones, la ramblas, the old city etc. We will stay here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dijon1
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 4 night stay in Barcelona. We booked the Atrium Palace based on the reviews we read on Tripadvisor, we always check on here before we book anything! As soon as we arrived we knew we'd made the right choice. The hotel lobby is lovely and the reception staff made you feel instantly welcome. Our room was at the back of the hotel and overlooked the school playground. We did get a bit of noise but certainly not enough to be a nuisance, and to be honest you're not in the room much. It was small but very nice, and clean. The juice and water in the mini bar were free and re-stocked every day. Some of the reviews have said that they experienced noise from the other rooms, we didn't have any problems at all. The pool and sauna were lovely. We came home from a long day of walking and the pool was just what we needed. It is small but very nice. The restaurant is excellent, with great food. We had the buffett lunch a couple of times it was a fixed price, possibly more expensive than you'd pay elsewhere but the food was very good. Some of the reviews have commented that the breakfast is expensive, but you get such a huge choice and you can help yourself to as much as you want. We thought it was worth the money. The location of the hotel couldn't be better, you are near enough to everything to walk rather than taking the Metro and missing so much. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to stay in a nice hotel with friendly staff, with a first class location. Don't look any further than the Atrium Palace!!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: mujipor
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 3 day trip, i chose this hotel due to the reviews and was recommended by a friend who also stayed there. I found the location excellent! very central and very near to the metro station placia de gria. Also a ten minute walk to la ramblas. The hotel is beautiful, one of the best i have stayed in so far, they have a free internet access room with also a mini library. There is a spa but i never went to see it. I never had breakfast at the hotel but i did have dinner via room service one night! it was excellent food and not too expensive either. There is a wireless keyboard for you to access the internet via the tv (with charge of course) and satellite tv (blockbuster movies) also a charge. I bought the special package for around 24 hours and i received all channels plus music plus internet for around 35 euros, not bad i reckon. There is free juice and water and also i did receive the free slippers (bathrobe and slippers were provided for the spa to use, you could take away the slippers but if youw anted the bathrobe you would need to pay for it) Reception staff were helpful and polite. When we checked in they gave us maps and brochures for the city. There is a lounge area where you can just sit and relax and admire the artwork or there is a flat screen tv for you to watch. Overall i loved this hotel! oh, there was also a digital safe, an iron board, hairdryer and mini bar in room. I stayed for three nights and the room was 99 euros for a double. I highly recommend this hotel, i would stay there again definitely! The only thing i have to say badly of this place is i didnt have a good view (it was just facing another building) however we did have large windows we could open, i found barcelona rather warm this time of year 18c and compared to scotland which is currently 4c it was warm! the hotel was very warm too, we had to have the ac on as well as opening the large windows! and another thing is, sometimes other guests are too noisy, it sounds like they have no respect for other guests since they SLAM the doors!! I had a great time in barcelona and being at this hotel made my stay even more comfortable and relaxed

Reviews.Title: “Its OK”
Reviews.Author: Englanderin
Reviews.Content: The Apsis Atrium Palace is very central and close to many key sights - its possible to take the train from the airport (2.3 euros) and walk from Playa Catlunya (10 minutes walk) to this hotel. The hotel is comfortable. (My room had no view - it just looked out on the central core of the building).The hotel provides free water and juice in rooms - an iron is a bonus. There is also a free safe - a necessity in this city. The hotel's website claims slippers and bodymilk are available - this is not so. The hotel has limited communal areas. Three sofas and an area that serves as a combined bar/restaurant and breakfast room. The indoor 'pool' is too small to swim in. Breakfast is good - the fresh fruit excellent - but the bread frozen rolls reheated. For a little more money - its probably possible to get a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “recommend the Atrium Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day city break to Barcelona (1st - 5th Nov 2005). We were delighted with the hotel and the city. We had a lovely bedroom & bathroom. No complaints. Rooms were spotless & cleaned every day. There was a safe in the room - very handy. Staff were always courteous and most helpful. On our first night we ate in the hotel for convenience. The food was excellent, while not cheap. It lacked atmosphere, because it was a bit quiet. Because we were celebrating an anniversary - a bottle of bubbly was left in our room. (We did have to show a marriage cert). There is a small swimming pool & gym which we didn't use. But the jacuzzi & particularly the sauna were wonderful after a days sightseeing. Bathrobes & pool slippers are freely available & made the trips to the sauna easy & comfortable. The hotel is very well located for anything that you might want to do or see in Barcelona. It has a small library, with several PC's for free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shoechick
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We stayed two nights pre-cruise and it was great. Our only complaint was the bed is a little hard. Bathrooms are nice and big, free internet access, free juice and waters in the room and the breakfast deal is great if you book it on line. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: brianmcstea
Reviews.Content: Wonderful modern hotel, spotless luxury rooms, in central location would stay here again, lovely.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotels for 3 nights. great location. can walk to some attractions. nice breakfast. free internet service. would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: OxoLondon
Reviews.Content: I would agree with what the other reviews have said a about this hotel. Great location for shopping, the Ramblas and the old town. Close to Metro stop. Room was very modern and clean, stayed on the top floor at the back of the hotel - which was very quiet. The staff were really helpful and friendly. We had breakfast at the hotel which was fine. The area has loads of good restaurants and tapas bars. I would definitely stay at the hotel again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Centre of Barcalona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Apsis Hotel has an excellent location, near to Place Catalunya and between the old en new city of Barcalona (old = ramblas, going out, small shops , check out the Born area and new= great restaurants, best shops). Rooms were very nice for a european city hotel, don´t expect a very big room and beds, wood on the floor, iron and ironingboard in the room and TV with the latest movies and direct internet access - about 10 EUR a movie / one hour internet). The Spa in the hotel is small but nice, a sauna, jacuzzie and a little pool. Nice to relax after a hard day of shopping. Service was great, personal extremly friendly. We didn´t have breakfast or diner in the hotel, it´s not necessary, we advise to eat in the restaurants nearby, like on the corner. When I go the Barcalona again I don´t have to search a hotel, I know where to go, Apsis Atrium. Ask for the room with a terras (on the back of the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Would go back anytime..”
Reviews.Author: JackpotSpend
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews in Tripadvisor. We booked on the internet and had no problems. The staff at reception were friendly and spent time showing us maps and helping us to feel welcome. My usual worries about cleanliness were short lived - this is the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in and I am not easy to please. We had booked a double room at the back - it was on the first floor which turned out to be a non smoking floor. We had no problem with noise and slept like logs. This is the sort of hotel where you know you've made the right choice as soon as you walk through the front door.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently had a long weekend break in Barcelona, and wanted a modern hotel for our stay. After some online research, we went for the Apsis Atrium. Location wise, it was fantastic, just a short distance from the Passeig de Gracia metro station, but far enough away from the Placa Catalunya and La Rambla hubble and bubble. The room was modern and a reasonable size, although some of the fixtures and fittings were starting to show signs of wear and tear. The room was also not that clean, with ring marks on the surfaces and visible dust in places. There were also no tea making facilities in the room, although water and juice were free from the minibar. Breakfast was also a little pricey at €15 per head. Much better value could be had at one of the cafes up Passeig de Gracia. Overall, a little disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but had one flaw”
Reviews.Author: amurray82
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend for 4 nights in August. It was in an excellent location, right near the Placa Catalunya, the shops, restaurants and subway stops. The room was lovely- a fine size considering we weren't in it for long periods of time. The fact that you got free water and juice in the mini bar was a big plus when staying in the sweltering heat of August! The only major flaw was the noise. We stayed in a room in the middle of the hotel, overlooking the playground. This was not a problem, as there were no kids at school when we were there. What was a major problem was the thinness of the walls. Whenever the people in the next room used the toilet, had a shower etc. it felt like they were in the same room as us. One night, people came in very late and made a horrendous amount of noise, banging doors etc., which kept us up for a while. I know this is a problem in hotels, but this seemed exceptionally worse than any other hotel I have stayed in before. But despite this problem, I had a very enjoyable stay. The staff were friendly and very helpful. I emailed them before I arrived, requesting a double rather than a twin room and they sorted this out for us. The hotel was clean, and was a nice size, not too big and not too small. Didn't use the swimming pool or other facilities because too busy sightseeing! I would definitely recommend it, but maybe bring some ear plugs if you are a light sleeper!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: fjal
Reviews.Content: Stayed only three days, not nearly long enough! Wonderful small suite - staying with our two children. Very comfortable and clean room, top floor, large balcony with hot tub. Loved views over roof tops, no traffic noise once windows were shut. Great location, very short walk to be right in centre of everything. Hotel staff helpful and friendly. Small swim pool, but we weren't there for that, so that was fine. Great breakfasts. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: djr915
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay for active trips. Great place for a reasonable price. It is convenient to most major tourist activities in the city. The rooms are nice and we recently remodeled. The staff is helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Atrium”
Reviews.Author: summercruiser
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Atrium, but have a few comments. The hotel is in a great location, near the Ramblas and the staff were very helpful with suggestions for reservations, sightseeing, etc. The buffet breakfast was interesting with many regional offerings and if one reserved online, the cost was only about 7 euros. When we arrived, we were given 2 smoking rooms, although we had requested non-smoking. One room was okay, but the other smelled smoky. We were given another room which was a non-smoking room. The hotel had tried to give us two rooms together and that's why we ended up in smoking. The major problem was that while one room was nicely airconditioned (# 305) the other (211) stayed at about 80. So, if you care, I would suggest you request the rooms that stay cooler. The swimming pool was miniscule. We would return there, although try to get a cooler room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/location”
Reviews.Author: thebunter
Reviews.Content: Decided on Apsis Atrium Palace after reading reviews on the web. We were not disappointed. Location is perfect and hotel staff were amongst the most helpful one could hope to find while travelling anywhere. Only complaint is the rooms are a little noisy and walls need soundproofed. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and would indeed stay again on our next trip to Barcelona (one of the top cities in the World....it has everything!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: NCK72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atrium Palace during a 3 day visit to Barcelona. The hotel is very clean, nicely decorated, friendly staff. The location is great as it is very central, only 5 minutes walk to Placa Cataluna but far enough away to be out of the hustle and bustle. Very reasonably priced, including drinks in the bar, although we only ordered wine. Will stay here the next time we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: CSHGalway
Reviews.Content: Very Central,Good staff.Try and get a room overlooking the main Street,as the evening sunshine pours in thru your balcony-beautiful!.Bar & Rest area a bit basic but try Sumon & Porquesi Restaraunts close by-top class and very trendy...enjoy the best city in europe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for time out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! If Barcelona weren't such a wonderful city, we'd have liked to have spent more time in our room. The requested queen bed room in the back had no view but was very quiet, spacious, attractive, modern and comfortable. The location is ideal for hoofing it to all the attractions or catching the subway or even the bus to the airport, but is quiet later at night. Recommended without hesitation. Mary H, Chicago

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT !!!”
Reviews.Author: ScottRosenthal
Reviews.Content: I am in the hotel industry. I have to HIGHLY PRAISE the staff at the Apsis Atrium Palace. Everyone offered exceptional customer service. The property was beautiful ! Keep up the GREAT WORK !!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: joyce_ch
Reviews.Content: We splurged and booked one of the suites and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The online photos don't do justice to the space, especially the lovely rooftop terrace which has two chaise lounges, a table which had floating candles in a lovely bowl, and a hot tub. The decor was modern and had an imaginative use of color. We had two tvs and two minibars, each of which was stocked with the free water and juice each day. Breakfast is a real treat. It is hard to imagine what more they could offer. It is a huge buffet with a bacon/sausage and egg area, a regional ham and sausage and cheese area, and a pastry/yogurt/cereal/ etc area. Great variety and high quality. As one reviewer stated, yes, there really is champagne for breakfast if you are so inclined. The staff was helpful and gracious, and the opportunity for free email is great. Didn't try the spa. Only complaint was advice to visit a rather haughty French restaurant (which we left before ordering) when we had asked for a Spanish regional restaurant. Unrelated to hotel, we would suggest taking the Touristic Bus company which has two routes rather than the long one. We were stuck on the long route for far too long when we could have had more flexibility on the other line. Do stay at this hotel. English spoken well, extremely clean, and lovely.

Reviews.Title: “A first class hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DinnyKnow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a fantastic week in Barcelona, staying at the Atrium Palace. The location of the hotel is great. Close to everything yet far enough away from the busy Ramblas and Gothic quarter. The staff were excellent and the rooms were kept spotless. In fact the whole hotel was spotless, including the pool and fitness suite. We did not eat in the hotel but the small reataurant seemed airy and relaxed. I would suggest that if you intend staying here request a room at the front which has a small balcony and great veiws. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: n1952
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with some nice touches - free mineral water and fruit juice in the mini bar - a godsend after a days sightseeing. Great location - a few minutes walk from the airport bus. Helpful staff - great advice on where to eat - where to go and where to avoid at night. Spotlessly clean rooms.First class breakfast - with lots of choice. Spent 4 nights at the Atrium palace in late March - will certainly be back. If I had to find a fault it would be the rather noisy plumbing and the size of the pool & fitness area. Truthfully though this is nit picking. I think this hotel is great value.

Reviews.Title: “Atrium Palace is an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: AKMCT
Reviews.Content: The Atrium Palace was a great find in Barcelona! The hotel is in an excellent location in the Eixample area, within easy walking distance to Las Ramblas, two metro stations and the Placa Catalunya. The rooms are tiny but well appointed with great showers and nice toiletries. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the Gran Via, and it was quite nice to sit outside and read a book for a while after walking around all day. The traffic on the Gran Via is quite noisy, but the room must have extra thick glass, as you could barely hear any outside noise once you closed the sliding door. The staff was superb, and every restaurant they recommended was excellent. We booked our rooms online and were able to take advantage of the $7.50E breakfast price. The buffet is very nice with both hot and cold items as well as cappuccino's etc. on request. There is also free water and juice in the room minibars which are refilled daily. We would definitely stay here again, should we return to Barcelone.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy M
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Spain for a company trade show. All our reservations were handled online. The hotel was very prompt in getting back to us by email if we had a question about our upcoming reservations. There were 18 in our party and we had 9 rooms. It was very clean and quiet. The service at the front desk was very helpful in setting up dinner arrangements and entertainment for our large group. The language barrier was not a problem. There was at least one person at the desk that spoke English every time we needed assistance with something. We were in Barcelona for 3 nights, we spent about 180 euro's a night but this included an excellent breakfast each morning. The rooms varied quite a bit in size and in view. Everything in Barcelona is tight packed. Our particular room was small but adaquite. The bathrooms were very nice and the showers excellent with plentiful hot water and water pressure. Some on the rooms had views of the street and were bigger in size, some looked at the brick wall of the building next door, some overlooked a school yard. We didn't go to Barcelona to spend time in our room so the size and view really wasn't an issue. The air conditioning worked great, for some reason the hall ways and elevators were very warm. The elevators everywhere we went were tiny. This hotel was no exception. We tight packed it into the elevator with just my husband and I and 5 pieces of luggage. These elevators were not built for wide bodied Americans!! The location was excellent for many of the sights. I'd reccommend this hotel for a pleasant but not extravagant stay in Barcelona. The use of the computers in the business center was free, everyone in our group enjoyed that feature. I never made it down to the spa or exercise area's so can't make a comment on them.

Reviews.Title: “atrium palace perfect little holiday hotel”
Reviews.Author: katybStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on trip advisor. We were not dissapointed.The hotel is of a good standard with clean, spacious rooms. The free juice and water were a bonus as was a book all about Barcelona in the bedrooms.The spa was not any great shakes but it was nice to relax in the jacuzzi after being on your feet all day. Another tip from this website was to book direct with the hotel on their website. we saved quite a bit of money plus got breakfast for half price which was well worth it with bacon, eggs , coffee, juice and a cold selection and the most delicious little cakes. kept us going till about 3pm each day The staff were friendly and happy to give out advice on the city together with maps etc and the hotel was centrally located with 2 metro stations nearby. On the downside the play ground was noisy during the day until about 9pm but who wants to be in the hotel during the day or be in bed before 9pm!! The kids could not be heard with the windows closed anyway.(there were no activities played on a sunday ) All in all this hotel was a real find and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable hotel. Not so good Spa/Gym.”
Reviews.Author: JayAd
Reviews.Content: Lovely, comfortable hotel. The rooms to the rear overlook a school in a courtyard, so playtimes can get a bit noisy. Staff were very helpful and friendly. We made use of the indoor pool, as we have young child, and it is rather small. If more than two people are in there it becomes uncomfortable. The jacuzzi was alright for the first five minutes, then the very strong chemicals began to sting our eyes. Not ideal. The gym left a lot to be desired. It contained 3 pieces of equipment, and only two worked. The Sauna was even worse. Hottest temp. it reached was about 65 degrees, because the cleaner kept switching it off!! However, the hotels location was great. We visited for 3 days, and there wasn't enough time to fit everything in. The Bus de Touristic is a great way to see the city. The hotel makes a great base due to it's location and the proximity of the Metro or the Tourist Bus. Quite a distance from the harbour, though. There was also a good choice at breakfast time, everything was lovely - even champagne!! Overall, if you will use the Spa/Leisure facilities then I would look elsewhere. As a base to explore the city, then the hotel cannot be faulted. Rooms were spotlessly clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great apart from the noise”
Reviews.Author: fekker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice boutique-style hotel in a great location in the city. Only a few minutes walk from La Rambla, the hotel offers good modern accomodation and pleasant staff. However, don't be fooled by the Spa offering. This is NOT a spa hotel. The Spa features are tiny and, although, good quality, you'll feel that you're in a damp basement rather than a serene tranquil relaxation zone. Our stay was totally ruined by the location of our room which over-looked a square in the centre of the group of buildings - the square was a school playground. The air-conditioning didn't work in our room we had to sleep with the windows open. By 8am it was impossible to sleep and the noise continued all day until around 8pm (the school became a sports pitch at night). The sound of 200 kids screeming really drills into your skull after 2 days. If you do stay at this hotel, don't accept a room adjacent to the playground from hell!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in best location”
Reviews.Author: Jonnyboyok
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel that is clean, quiet and comfortable. The rooms are well equipped and the sound proofing first class. The buffet breakfast is top value for money and relatively cheap if booked at the time via the hotel website (half price ) The free juice and bottled water is a nice touch as is the chocolates in the evening. The 24 hour free internet access helped add to that "nice touch". Overall the hotel is terrific value for money and ideally suited for those seeking somewhere quiet in a quiet area that is close to all the local ammenities. The only downside, though not everyone will agree, is that the bar and lounge area is very quiet in the evenings and closes at 12 midnight but the bar prices are amongst the cheapest in the whole of Barcelona. Excellent value for money and well worth a visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: SixtyDays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atrium Palace for 3 nights at the end of February for my girlfriend's birthday. We booked directly with the hotel on their website, and requested a double room at the back on one of the upper floors, and got a room on the 4th floor overlooking the sports area at the back of the hotel. We stayed over a weekend so no problem with the noise either as the kids weren't at school. Basically the courts are used until about 9pm in the evening, but that was not a problem as we'd be out most of the time anyway. The room was clean and large enough for us. The free juice and water was a very nice touch. The best thing however is the location as well as the facilities. We paid 99 euros for a night and for this amount it is generally very difficult to get a central hotel with a swimming pool, jacuzzi and sauna. The swimming pool is small and the gym could be better equipped, but the jacuzzi and sauna were fantastic after a day's walking before going out in the evening. In a nutshell, if you can get a room at the Atrium Palace from their website for a good price I wouldn't hesitate. The location, service and facilities (including free internet access in the office/library) of the hotel were much better than we have experienced in other, more expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Spa under renovatoin at the Atrium Palace”
Reviews.Author: cardigan24
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend celebrating my boyfriend's 30th birthday at the Atrium Palace Hotel in Barcelona and we were very disappointed to learn that the sauna and jacuzzi etc. was closed. We were not told this on checkin but found out on arrival at reception in our robes! I specifially chose this 4 star hotel for it's location and facilities so I really felt we had been let down. Also the heat in the bedrooms (and halls) is unbearable. It is only about 8 degrees outside but there is no need to have full heat on in the hotel, the aircon in the bedroom did nothing but blow out more warm air! Also our Cava was not in our bedroom on arrival but arrived that night - just another little something to let me down. I did a lot of research to find a nice affordable hotel in Barcelona and used this site, unfortunately the hotel let me down and I will not be returning. I asked for a discounted rate (we paid euro 155 per night) because the facilities were not available to us but they refused.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - recommended”
Reviews.Author: Smokey-Smudge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of December for my husband's 30th. We booked direct with the hotel, requested a double room at the front on one of the upper floors, and got all of our requests. The room was clean, big enough, with free juice and water, and the hotel is in a fantastic location - it's only 10 minutes walk from where the Ryanair bus from Girona drops you, and a few blocks from the Ramblas. Good tapas bars nearby, which the hotel staff recommended. We had to ask a couple of times for the complimentary Cava for my husband's birthday, but staff were very apologetic and brought it up. We didn't get a chance to use the pool - so much to do in Barcelona in a weekend! I thought the hotel was great value in such a good location and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Atrium Palace”
Reviews.Author: Algarvebird
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Apsis Atrium Palace and felt that we had to share our views so that everyone can have a great time in Barcelona. The situation of the hotel is perfect and we walked everywhere - Las Ramblas, Latin Quarter, Gaudi Buildings and even the beach. We had asked for a nice room for our wedding anniversary and we were very pleased to be given a room on the 5th floor with views over the Gran Via. The room was very modern and clean, there was no road noise when the windows were closed so we enjoyed a good nights sleep. The staff could not be more helpful and were able to recommend good restaurants (this is essential with about 2000 to choose from). The icing on the cake was the breakfast which we got at a 50% discount. The kitchen is open so you can see the cooking - great sausages and bacon, nice cakes and pastries too. We even took advantage of the champagne that was cooling in the ice bucket. (Well it would have been a shame not to)!!! We will definitely be returning to this lovely hotel soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: vossvol
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Apsis Atrium in January and enjoyed it very much. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a suite on top floor. So we had two rooms and a wonderful bath with jacuzzi. In addition the suite had a a huge terrace overlooking the town. Service could have been a bit friendlier, especally room service. Pool and SPA area is very small but big enough for a short relax after shopping. If I would stay there again I would definitely take a suite.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cyndtan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January 2005 and loved it. The rooms are clean, modern and spacious. What a great location too. Free use of the office room with computers, internet access, printers, etc. came in handy. Our friends who were staying at another hotel wished they could switch when they saw our room.

Reviews.Title: “i have found a home from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have found a home from home, ibis leeds centre is one of the friendliest hotels i have ever stayed in, you are always greeted with a smile, i have stayed here 4 times now and the team already recognise my face and always say hello mr...... The rooms are great, the hotel has been open since august 2004, and the quality is still the same, brand new! queen size bed with an ensuite power shower........no request is too much here the team are 24 hours and always help no matter what...... Breakfast is great i stay in ibis regularly, but this one is great they do cooked breakfast too! The bar is open with a lovely atmosphere, if im in a quiet mood i can just sit and have my excellent meal bought to my table, or if its a sports night sit and watch my favourite team......... my home from home is always going to be ibis from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for 10 nights in January 2005, and loved it. The staff was very friendly, the location was awsome, and the room was very spacious and modern. The wirless internet in the room was deffinatly a plus. The breakfeast buffet had a huge selection, and was very good. The only downside is that the fitness room is very basic, and the pool is quite small. We look forward to going back somday soon.

Reviews.Title: “great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: helen
Reviews.Content: just returned yesterday the 11 jan we had a great time.hotel was very clean staff were very friendly,the facilities were great, free water and orange jiuce every day from the mini bar in room.the only thing you do not get a kettle in your room if i go again i will take 1 for when you wake in the mornings.breakfast was nice needs beans though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a week in this hotel and was extremely pleased! was a little aprehensive after reading earlier reviews however am so glad i did not cancel my booking. The rooms were great, modern and clean. The extra touches such as the free water and soft drinks, bathrobes and slippers made my stay even better. The bathrooms were very nice too, spacious and chic all in marble, with an excellent power shower. Hotel location could not be better. Me and my partner had a balcony room on the 4th floor, balcony rooms are smaller however the size of the room was more than ample. Our room was right at the front of the hotel and our balcony was out on the main road which was extremely busy however once the balcony doors were shut the noise was blocked out! Our air conditioning was excellent, infact one morning i woke up that cold i had to turn it down, very good considering it was the middle of july and about 32 degrees outside! So if there were problems with this as previous reviewers have mentioned it has been rectified! What can i say about the basement floor other that brilliant! the pool, although small was very refreshing and looked great as lights were underneath the pool (these changed colour creating a relaxing and luxurious atmosphere) the jacuzzi was great and as it was open from 7am-midnight i definately recomment that you experience it! Although i did not use the sauna and gym they looked very nice. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We did not stay in the hotel restaraunt as i thought it to be a little overpriced so i cannot comment however it looked nice. You are spoilt for choice for restaraunts in barcelona, if you are unsure where to go the hotel provides an excellent book in your room which gives you info on all the restaraunts as well as places of interest. All in all i had an excellent holiday and this hotel was a major factor in this. i would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “So good we're going back soon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Didn't know where to stay in Barcelona so found this site and went with the recomendations. Stayed here for a long weekend June 2004 to celebrate wifes' birthday. Hotel was outstanding and staff so helpful, even supplied a complementary bottle of fiz. Reception were always willing to give great suggestions for places to eat (if you like fish you are in for a real treat!!!). Shops, including designer names if you want, all within 2-5 minutes walk. Oh! and "La Rambas" about 5 mins walk (don't miss it if you like street entertainers). Only draw back was indoor pool, more like a big bath!!! Still, am going back their soon. Hope you enjoy as much as we did.
